Title: Solver - Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.




At Exsolvæ, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.




Your Role:

As a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.




Preferred Skills

Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.




Technical Implementation

Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.




Project Management

Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're a global IT consulting company and a software development service provider that helps organizations operate at their best. With 30+ years of experience, +6 Global locations, and +1000 employees, TEAM combines technology expertise, valuable insights, business intelligence, and a client-centered approach to address challenges in business operations, digital transformation, risk management, compliance, business continuity, and more.




Description:

Team International is looking for Data analysts to join the FinCrime team working remotely from the EU.




Requirements:

The ability to start immediately or with a short notice
At least a bachelor's degree in data analysis or a similar field
At least 1,5 years of experience in Data Analysis
Understanding of basic and intermediate statistics
Experience with processing financial transactions
SQL, Python and Git
Outstanding English both verbal and written
Experience in the field of anti-financial crime or banking is a plus




Benefits

Being a part of TEAM International gives you the chance to work on challenging projects with great professionals, international clients, and the latest technologies.




We have a great benefits package that includes:

PTO days
Floating holidays
Sport allowance
Private Health Insurance compensation etc.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Brussels Airlines

Brussels Airlines, part of the Lufthansa Group, is the national airline of Belgium with its home base at Brussels Airport.

Our mission is to be the most reliable airline, making everyone feel at home.

We are passionate about what we do, whether it’s on board, in an office, in the hangar or at an airport. Our people are recognized for always going above and beyond and for constantly challenging themselves.

Purpose of the position

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team, which is company-wide responsible to provide end-to-end data solutions, as well cooperate with Departmental Data Analysts on their Analytical roadmap. In your role you cooperate intensively with Data Engineers and Business Stakeholders from all areas (Commercial to Operations), and mainly focus on the original intake and analysis, as well final front-end part of the solution. The ability to think along with different stakeholders, together with being solution-oriented, are key assets within this role. You and the team aim to increase the level of Data Analytics in the different company areas to achieve a high impact on decision making, and therefore play a vital role in the future success of the company.

Your Tasks


Intake and Analysis: Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document business requirements to translate them into final data solutions. Ensure that these requirements are aligned with business goals and technical capabilities.
Development of BI Reports: Design, develop, and maintain interactive reports and dashboards using Spotfire and Power BI. Customize reports to meet user needs and provide actionable insights.
Improvement and Innovation: Proactively evaluate current reports and processes, identifying opportunities for improvement. Recommend and implement new features, functionalities, and enhancements to make reports more actionable and user-friendly.
Provide Data Analytics & Insights: Leverage data analytics to generate meaningful insights for your business stakeholders. Transform raw data into actionable recommendations that help drive decision-making, identify trends, optimize business performance, and uncover new opportunities.
Data Validation: ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data used in reports and dashboards. Regularly perform data quality checks and resolve any discrepancies or errors identified.
Maintenance and Governance: Oversee the maintenance of Available reports and dashboards, ensuring data quality, consistency, and performance. Implement governance standards for data access, security, and reporting best practices.
Incident Management: Handle incidents related to BI reports and dashboards. Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption to business users.
Documentation: Ensure that all BI solutions are well-documented for knowledge sharing and future reference.
BI Community Support: Provide ongoing support to the BI user community, including training, answering enquiries, and troubleshooting issues. Foster collaboration and knowledge sharing within and outside the team.
PMO Activities: Assist in project management activities for key business initiatives. Help track project progress, timelines, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with business priorities and goals.


Your profile


Master degree in Business, Computer or Data Science, or equivalent through experience in a data or analytical role.
3 years of relevant data experience, not in a user role, but in a supporting/development role.
Proficiency in BI tools, dashboard and report design (Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Programming skills (SQL, Python, Pyspark,...).
Datawarehouse understanding, in particular being able to exploit it to develop data solutions. A basic understanding of Azure DevOps and Databricks is seen as a plus.
Analytical mindset and ability to understand complex issues, as well the ability to come forward with clear manageable solutions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Strong project management and organizational skills: able to organize a bigger project, or work on a bigger scope.
Action oriented with a positive and solution oriented attitude. Eye for sustainable solutions is key.
Team player and positive influencer with motivational skills.
Curiosity for business and data, along with an interest in emerging data technologies.
Experience with Agile methodology is considered a plus.
Very good English verbal and written skills.


What We Offer


A flexible reward plan that allows you to optimize part of your salary
A flexible work environment focused on activity-based working and home office possibility
Travel benefits
Company car (or car allowance and/or public transport subscription)
Profit sharing
Group insurance
Company medical plan (optional)
Representation & homeworking allowance
Meal & eco vouchers
A spot in a very enthusiastic team & a great company to work for
Show more

  • Very good English verbal and written skills.

  • A flexible reward plan that allows you to optimize part of your salary
  • A flexible work environment focused on activity-based working and home office possibility
  • Travel benefits
  • Company car (or car allowance and/or public transport subscription)
  • Profit sharing
  • Group insurance
  • Company medical plan (optional)
  • Representation & homeworking allowance
  • Meal & eco vouchers
  • A spot in a very enthusiastic team & a great company to work for

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:


Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.


Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Background

NCIA, as the main ICT service provider in NATO, is the main technical entity providing subject matter expertise to support Allied Command Transformation (ACT) Science and Technology (S&T), NATO Digital Staff (NDS) Innovation Programmes of Work (PoW) and relevant exercises in 2025. NCIA Chief Technology Office (CTO) Innovating Team is looking for a Contractor who will provide day-to-day technical support to the PoW projects with the two NATO bodies.

Role Duties And Responsibilities

Under the direction / guidance of the NCIA Point of Contact or delegated staff, they will perform the following activities:


Support NCI Agency in the NATO Programmes of Work with ACT and NDS in the area of Science & Technology and Innovation
Gather and analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources, including scientific publications, news articles, social media, and market reports
Perform horizon scanning and trend-scouting activities in the area of emerging and disruptive technologies by detecting promising technologies as well as potential applications
Design and implement data models, repositories, and ETL pipelines to capture and record signals from diverse sources as a structured dataset to enable ad-hoc analysis and reporting
Develop clear, concise, and actionable reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders across the organization
Develop dashboards to enable monitoring of the analysis results
Utilize natural language processing (NLP) and other AI techniques to analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources


Essential Skills And Experience


At least five years of experience in a mid-level data analytics role
Strong understanding of AI and its potential applications in data analysis – particularly Natural language processing (NLP) techniques, language models and multilingual technologies.
Strong programming, data modelling, and data visualization skills, including Python, SQL, PowerBI, R, TensorFlow and NoSQL DBs.
Experience with Extract, Transform, Load tools and techniques integrating with REST APIs and document management systems.
Proven experience with technology horizon scanning techniques and identification of technology trends and high potential use-cases.
Proven experience with media monitoring, media data analysis, threat analysis in text and text classification.
Proven experience with software/tool development in the area of strategic foresight analysis and horizon scanning.
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills particularly as applied to trend scouting and innovation management


Desirable Skills And Experience


Relevant experience with NATO and/or international organizations is highly desired.


Education


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (computer science, data science, software engineering, machine learning, etc.) or equivalent experience.


Working Location


Remote


Working Policy


Off-Site


Travel


Some travel to other NATO sites may be required


Security Clearance


Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance


We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.
Show more
HTML:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:

  • Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
  • Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
  • Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
  • Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
  • Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.

Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Background

NCIA, as the main ICT service provider in NATO, is the main technical entity providing subject matter expertise to support Allied Command Transformation (ACT) Science and Technology (S&T), NATO Digital Staff (NDS) Innovation Programmes of Work (PoW) and relevant exercises in 2025. NCIA Chief Technology Office (CTO) Innovating Team is looking for a Contractor who will provide day-to-day technical support to the PoW projects with the two NATO bodies.

Role Duties And Responsibilities

Under the direction / guidance of the NCIA Point of Contact or delegated staff, they will perform the following activities:

  • Support NCI Agency in the NATO Programmes of Work with ACT and NDS in the area of Science & Technology and Innovation
  • Gather and analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources, including scientific publications, news articles, social media, and market reports
  • Perform horizon scanning and trend-scouting activities in the area of emerging and disruptive technologies by detecting promising technologies as well as potential applications
  • Design and implement data models, repositories, and ETL pipelines to capture and record signals from diverse sources as a structured dataset to enable ad-hoc analysis and reporting
  • Develop clear, concise, and actionable reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders across the organization
  • Develop dashboards to enable monitoring of the analysis results
  • Utilize natural language processing (NLP) and other AI techniques to analyze vast amounts of data from diverse sources

Essential Skills And Experience

  • At least five years of experience in a mid-level data analytics role
  • Strong understanding of AI and its potential applications in data analysis – particularly Natural language processing (NLP) techniques, language models and multilingual technologies.
  • Strong programming, data modelling, and data visualization skills, including Python, SQL, PowerBI, R, TensorFlow and NoSQL DBs.
  • Experience with Extract, Transform, Load tools and techniques integrating with REST APIs and document management systems.
  • Proven experience with technology horizon scanning techniques and identification of technology trends and high potential use-cases.
  • Proven experience with media monitoring, media data analysis, threat analysis in text and text classification.
  • Proven experience with software/tool development in the area of strategic foresight analysis and horizon scanning.
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills particularly as applied to trend scouting and innovation management

Desirable Skills And Experience

  • Relevant experience with NATO and/or international organizations is highly desired.

Education

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (computer science, data science, software engineering, machine learning, etc.) or equivalent experience.

Working Location

  • Remote

Working Policy

  • Off-Site

Travel

  • Some travel to other NATO sites may be required

Security Clearance

  • Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance

We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
💼Job Title: Data Scientist

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

💼Work regime: Hybrid

🌐Language: English: Fluent spoken and written Dutch: Fluent/Good level OR French: Fluent/Good level

🔥Keywords: Predictive Analytics, AI Models, Data Science, Python, Marketing Campaigns

Sector:

Our client is a is a prominent telecommunications company known for its extensive network infrastructure and comprehensive range of services. It provides innovative solutions in internet, mobile, and television communications, catering to both residential and business customers.

Role Overview:

Mission Context:




The Predictive Analytics team within the Marketing and Communication department aims to provide predictive AI models to enable impactful and efficient campaigns by optimizing reach and relevance for customers and augmenting employees in the campaigning process.

Function Description:

We are looking for a medior/senior data scientist with a proven track record in building and deploying data science models to support marketing campaigns. You will be part of a data science team and will work on the following:
Tackle various business challenges by creating AI models to enhance client experiences, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
Utilize a range of analytical methodologies within predictive AI, including large language models, classical statistical/machine learning techniques, and uplift modeling.
Capture business needs, perform data analyses, build models, and identify relevant target groups to achieve business objectives. Set up tests to measure model impact.
Inform, advise, and support Marketing & Communications Managers on the use of predictive models.
Present complex technical concepts as clear, actionable insights for Marketing & Communication Managers.
Follow up on production runs from data preparation, scoring, and validation of AI models. Maintain and monitor model performance to detect quality issues.
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering) and continuous improvement cycles of models.
Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI models in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Apply guidelines and best practices for responsible AI.
Collaborate with a team of motivated data scientists eager to learn, share expertise, and work together.




Education:

At least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science. Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science are also encouraged to apply.

Required Experience/Knowledge:

At least 3 years of relevant experience.

Technical Experience:

Mandatory: Strong expertise in Python and Python data science environment (e.g., deep learning), Git, bash, SQL.

Preferable: Experience with Domino Data Science Platform, SAS, recommender systems, language models, optimization under constraints, Django.

Business Experience:

Preferable: Experience in campaigning, direct marketing, A/B testing.










A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Associate Data Analyst (Brussels)
Description:
Company: POLITICO

Politico is looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join the Data Analytics team based in our Brussels office. The team is responsible for understanding and delivering reporting, analyses and other data capabilities that will enable Politico to achieve its strategic goals. This role will support all of Politico’s business operations, including newsletters, websites, paid-for services and more.

What You’ll Do


Support Politico’s commercial operations across European and US markets
Gather requirements from business, technical and editorial stakeholders
Discover, clean and organize data into usable datasets
Produce analyses, build reporting and present to stakeholders
Generate visualizations and dashboards that aid business decision-making
Develop materials to explain project findings
Work with the wider team in Brussels and Washington DC to develop skills and knowledge


What You'll Need

The following requirements describe an ideal candidate, so we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every single item:


Passionate about Politico’s mission to deliver nonpartisan journalism on politics and policy
Proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in Python
Experience with BI tools a plus
Familiarity with modern data warehouses (Snowflake) and cloud platforms (AWS)
Knowledge of Git
Knowledge of ETL fundamentals


Skills & Competencies


Ability to translate business requests into workable analytical tasks
Ability to creatively draw upon available resources to respond to business questions and anticipate potential challenges and how to overcome them
Ability to work with data to produce useful and insightful analysis
Ability to communicate complex analysis to a non-technical audience
Ability to work collaboratively and learn from the wider team


About POLITICO

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.

Equal Opportunity

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.

Application Instructions

If you are interested in this opportunity, please send a cover letter and CV in English using the Apply button. Please note that we will only consider complete applications.

Location: Brussels

Employment level: Full-time

Type of role: Specialists

Updated: March 19, 2025

Job ID: 00625

Title: Business Analyst (Power BI)
Description:
About the Job

Joining Capgemini Engineering means becoming part of a global organization that drives innovation and growth. With over 55 years of experience, a presence in 30 countries, and more than 55 000 employees, we offer an environment where you can elevate your career to new heights.

And that’s not all! As a Business Analyst (Power BI), you will play a key role for the Business planning process and product management activities for several accessories (for example winter complete wheels, styling accessories, multimedia accessories, transport accessories, safety and comfort accessories) for vehicle models. Together with your team, you will work on exciting projects in the automotive industry!

Capgemini Engineering: Get The Future You Want

Your Responsibilities

In this role, you will be responsible for:

Collaborating with diverse teams to identify, clarify, document and communicate business requirements according to client’s business needs.
Actively contributing to the success of projects by doing Market analysis/Competitor analysis/Sales analysis.
Building strong, sustainable relationships to coordinate and communicate with stakeholders to translate their needs into business requirements.
Business case and financial analysis.
Project management – Stakeholder management.
Data analysis.




Your Profile

At Capgemini Engineering, we’re looking for someone who:

Has a passion for Data and business intelligence project.
Brings at least 1 year of experience in Business intelligence tools (Power BI, …).
Knowledge of project management tools (Jira, MS Project…).
Language Skills: Fluent in English. French and/or Dutch is a plus.
Master’s degree Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, Business Administration, Business Management, Suppy Chain or equivalent.




Success in this role often comes down to:

Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.

Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.

Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.

Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.




What We Offer

At Capgemini Engineering, we offer more than just a job:

A full-time position with attractive secondary benefits.
A competitive salary package, including a company car, laptop, meal vouchers, bonus system, and more.
Training and development: Access to courses and certifications to enhance your skills.
Flexibility: A hybrid work model that supports work-life balance.
Regular company outings and events to celebrate success together.




Recruitment Process

Our recruitment process includes the following steps:

A first screening via phone
An initial interview with a Talent Acquisition Professional.
A discussion with one of our People Managers to ensure the right fit.
A meeting with our Technical Colleagues to assess your skills and experience.




Ready for the next step? Apply now and explore how your future could look at Capgemini Engineering!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)




At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.




Your Mission:

Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.




What You Bring:

4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.




Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.




This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.




If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.




Full job description & application details here.




Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

What You Bring:

  • 4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
  • Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
  • Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
  • Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
  • Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
  • Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.


Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.


This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.


If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.


Full job description & application details here.


Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?




Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’




WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?




The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.




WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?




You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.




WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?




A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline); a doctorate is an asset.
Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.




WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?




A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Flexible working hours.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Opportunities for internal mobility.
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.




Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled Data Analyst ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in data analysis and interpretation to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

🔥 Your Responsibilities:



Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to uncover insights and trends that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data and communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business leaders to understand data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
Utilize statistical methods and machine learning techniques to analyze data and predict future trends.
Provide recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic planning and operational improvements.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings to support transparency and knowledge sharing.
Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and business intelligence.



🎯 Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in data analysis and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong track record of analyzing and interpreting complex datasets.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and reporting solutions.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and machine learning techniques.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural and dynamic team environment.



🚀 Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



💡 We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant







Permanent contract




FR or NL +EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.

We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You’ll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.




Check out some of our ongoing projects:




Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.




If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if they match your profile!




Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:




Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.




Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills:

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch+ English.




Your technical experience:

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.




Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid way of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances…




Apply now

We can’t wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Show more

Title: Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity – innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability to deliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities. Ogilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit Ogilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn, X, Instagram, and Facebook.

About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels’ WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices – our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally & internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a "lab” mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Responsibilities


Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‘saying’, ‘sharing’ and ‘searching’ online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.


PROFILE


A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today’s social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels’ codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Reporting and visualization skills


OFFER


Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels – the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency – Our words and promises produce actions.
Attractive package and benefits
Strong flexibility plan
Continuous training opportunities
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Equal Opportunity Employer. Ogilvy considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants from the United States can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "Know Your Rights" and Pay Transparency posters by clicking here.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.

  • We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
  • We thrive on transparency – Our words and promises produce actions.
  • Attractive package and benefits
  • Strong flexibility plan
  • Continuous training opportunities
  • As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Equal Opportunity Employer. Ogilvy considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants from the United States can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "Know Your Rights" and Pay Transparency posters by clicking here.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.

Title: Business Intelligence Support Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Support Analyst (Data & Reporting Analyst)

Location: Brussels, Belgic

Security Clearance Requirement: NATO Secret




Duties & Responsibilities

Support the rollout and operations of continuous listening initiatives.
Assist with ad hoc survey activities, including the further development of leavers' feedback surveys.
Support data and reporting governance, including:
Monitoring data quality (DQ)
Assisting data stewards and power users
Engaging in Service Level Agreement (SLA) discussions
Assist with organizational taxonomy review and operations.
Contribute to reporting and data visualization projects, including:
OBIA, OTBI, OBIEE
Reporting for LFS and RPMO
Handle ad hoc reporting requests, including:
Core HR, TA, PM reporting inquiries
Sick leave analysis
Annual reports
Support the monthly reporting cycle.
Participate in process improvement initiatives.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Analytical mindset: Ability to work with data and derive actionable insights.
Pragmatic problem-solving: Efficiently finding solutions to challenges.
Data visualization expertise.
Strong communication skills, including the ability to:
Convince others and lead smaller change initiatives.
Present complex matters in an audience-adjusted manner.
Structured approach: Ability to clarify complex and ambiguous information.
Project management & organizational skills: Ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Independent & self-sufficient: Proactive in seeking information and working autonomously.




Technical Skills

Project Management (PM)
Data visualization tools – Oracle BI, Power BI
Advanced Excel skills
PowerPoint proficiency
Data science (asset)
Automation (asset)
HR experience (beneficial but not required)

Title: Analytics Analyst
Description:
At Etex, our purpose is to inspire new ways of living. We are an international leader in sustainable construction, driven by a passion for excellence, but it's our people that are our top priority. We connect, collaborate, and champion the well-being of our employees, forming partnerships and pioneering change in our ever-evolving industry.

At Etex, we seek to make a meaningful impact in the lives of our customers and our communities.

 

Are you looking for a company where you can learn, grow & lead? Join us as Analytics Analyst and drive digital excellence!You will join the Analytics Operations domain, covering functional domains like Supply Chain, Manufacturing and ESG.

 

What You'll Do:

Understand the purpose & goal of the data product and the value it brings to business.
Build a prototype with the support of a BI Developer and/or Data Engineer to get the requirements right.
Design the reporting data model (I.e. star schema) that is fit for the requirements.
Detail & document the requirements coming from the demand intake (discovery phase) to a level of granularity so the BI Developer and/or Data Engineer can start executing their designs and builds.
Interact closely with the BPO areas to clarify requirements and understand value creation.
Work closely together with the IT application owners to align on the source data model and the way data will be provided (data exchange agreement).
Translate and documents requirements into a high-level solution design mapped on the current Data Platform architecture.
Bridge the gap between BPO areas and the technical delivery team (BI Developers / Data Engineers).

 

What You'll Bring:

Master’s  degree within relevant field.
Knowledge of data analysis, incl. collecting and elaborating business requirements.
Basic knowledge of the agile way of working.
Experience with creating reports and dashboards.
Knowledge of different analysis methodologies.
Knowledge of BI-tools and databases (like Power BI, Databricks, DAX, etc.).
Microsoft Certified Azure Fundamentals.

 

 

Why Join Us?

We are named the world's #1 most trustworthy company in the construction sector by Newsweek and Statista in 2023! And one of the top companies to grow your career in Belgium in 2023 according to LinkedIn!
Our culture – we connect & care about those around us. We nurture teamwork, communities, partnerships and new ways of working, placing the highest importance on the safety and working environment of our people.
Our ‘Road to Sustainability 2030’ is our plan to help build a better, sustainable future. We work towards this vision by caring about our social and environmental impacts and developing innovative solutions
We have a strong conviction that diversity of thinking helps us to deliver a strong and sustainable performance. It is also essential for us that everyone feels part of the team. In this spirit, we are committed to equal opportunities and zero tolerance towards discrimination
Flexibility: For us, hybrid and flexible working is all about trust, and we want you to be able to do your best work.

Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !


Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Vacature omschrijving

Om ons datateam te versterken zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven data analyst die een cruciale rol zal spelen in het interpreteren en gebruiken van commerciële en financiële gegevens om inzichten te bieden aan het managementteam.

Jouw Verantwoordelijkheden Omvatten Onder Meer


Opstellen en opvolgen van dashboards om de commerciële prestaties van de organisatie te monitoren, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
Maken van analyses en deep dives zowel proactief als op vraag. Op basis van de noden vanuit de business analyseer je de beschikbare informatie en vertaal je die in adviezen voor het managementteam.
Analyseren van verkoopgegevens, markttrends en klantgedrag om inzicht te krijgen in de prestaties van het assortiment en te komen tot een perfecte productmix.
Identificeren van kansen voor productuitbreiding en vernieuwing op basis van marktanalyse en klantbehoeften
Monitoren van voorraadniveaus en het optimaliseren van de voorraadrotatie.


Profiel


Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische en/of economische richting. Ook pas afgestudeerden zijn welkom.
Uitstekende kennis van Excel voor analyse en presentatie van gegevens.
Ervaring met opstellen van commerciële dashboards en rapporten is een extra troef.
Ervaring met SAP of vergelijkbare ERP-systemen is een pluspunt.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en probleemoplossend vermogen.
Hands-on mentaliteit om het terrein te verkennen en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.


Wij bieden


Teamsfeer – Reken op fijne collega’s die je steunen en met wie je samen plezier maakt.
Opleiding – Je wordt opgeleid in je job en daarnaast hebben we een aanbod van opleidingen voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, extra verlofdagen en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk.


Waarom werken bij DreamLand?

Bij DreamLand kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of logistiek medewerker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.
Show more

Title: BI Reporting Specialist
Description:
Seargin is a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries. At Seargin, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate.

Currently, for the new Seargin project, we are looking for a BI Reporting Specialist

Form: B2B contract

Location: Poland/Europe




Tasks scope

1. General role expectation

- Work on Site Service Data & Insights (SSDI) dataone project, ingest data from source system (Python, Talend and etc.), modeling use data vault methodology to transform data from PSA->RAW->BUSINESS, build data product in DP schema according to business demands




2. Data Visualization

- Build dashboard based on DP built in DP schema follow business stakeholders' expectation, need talk to stakeholders to understand the business process and logic in order to better understand the actual requirements




3. SSDI Sprint Planning & Review & Retrospective

- Attend sprint planning meetings, evaluate the effort needed for tasks planned in each sprint together, pick up the tasks interested in and would like to work on.

- Present your work during each sprint in each sprint review meeting directly to business stakeholders, collect feedback and accept recognition.

- Join Retrospective meetings, review what did good/not good during each sprint, raise your expectations, what do you think is important to SSDI long-term development, and grow together with the SSDI team.




4. Technical

- Understand the DataOne tech landscape, utilize the tools would benefit SSDI ambitions




Qualification

Data analysis with tools like Tableau, Thoughtspot, Grafana
Data transformation with SQL/dbt
Stakeholder management for individual dashboards, incl. consultancy and proactive engagement




Nice to have:

Familiar with Snowflake (common RDBMS), Gitlab, dbt and etc
Has experience with collibra, montecarlo and etc governance tool
Knowledge of data vault 2.0 modeling methodology
Be familiar with Python, Talend, ThoughtSpot would be a plus




Discover the Power of IT Excellence. Apply!

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
A propos de JEMS

Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…

Vos missions

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst confirmé(e) capable d'accompagner les métiers dans l'aide à la décision.

Vous Aurez La Charge De


Guider / recommander le Métier dans l’exploitation et la valorisation des multiples sources de données et identifier des leviers d’optimisation et d’amélioration des processus Business
Être l‘intermédiaire entre le Métier et la DSI
Accroître la connaissance de la clientèle d’une entreprise, conduire des études sur les bases de données, suivre les outils datamining pour analyser l’impact des actions marketing
Mener et conduire des études (coordination/pilotage)


Vos compétences

En Tant Que Data Analyst Vous Maitrisez


MS Office
Le requêtage SQL
Des outils BI Fonction Expertise sur les données du Métier
Des solutions Analytiques (Data Science ou Data Mining / BI)
Des outils de datavisualisation
La préparation de données


Votre profil

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur ou d’un parcours universitaire technique. Vous justifiez d’au minimum 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Analyst.

Avantages à travailler chez JEMS


Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)
Une entreprise reconnue "Great Place To Work"
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales


Mobilité

Une mobilité nationale et internationale pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de vie.

Diversité

Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur "Diversité" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
