Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist (Consultancy – Opdracht bij klant)




Over het project

Voor een klant in Brussel zoeken we een ervaren Data Analist die bijdraagt aan het analyseren en optimaliseren van datastromen. Je werkt binnen een consultancy-context, waarbij je 1 à 2 dagen per week onsite aanwezig bent bij de klant.




Jouw rol als Data Analist

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren, structureren en vertalen van complexe datastromen naar bruikbare inzichten. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende stakeholders binnen de organisatie en draagt bij aan de verdere optimalisatie van data-analyses en rapporteringstools.




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert dashboards en rapporten.
Je fungeert als aanspreekpunt voor de business binnen een functioneel domein en zorgt voor een duidelijke communicatie met stakeholders.
Je coördineert werkzaamheden binnen een team van ongeveer vijf personen en zorgt ervoor dat de functionele en technische scope correct wordt geïmplementeerd binnen de Agile sprintwerking.
Je blijft op de hoogte van trends en evoluties binnen data-analyse en past deze kennis toe in de praktijk.
Je stelt kritische vragen en past je communicatiestijl aan op basis van je gesprekspartner.
Je vertaalt business requirements naar concrete data-oplossingen met behulp van interviewtechnieken.
Je gebruikt SQL om zelfstandig queries op te stellen en datastromen te analyseren.




Jouw profiel

We zoeken een data-analist met een analytische mindset en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden. Jij herkent jezelf in de volgende punten:




Essentiële vaardigheden en ervaring:

Ervaring met data-analyse-oplossingen, inclusief zowel traditionele ETL-datawarehouses als moderne, event-gedreven architecturen.
Goede kennis van data-modellen zoals 3e normale vorm, Data Vault en dimensionele modellen.
Ervaring met Agile-methodologieën en Scrum (E2E Agility, Business Value, backlogbeheer, refinement, story slicing, etc.).
Praktische ervaring met tools zoals Jira en Confluence.
Hands-on ervaring met SQL voor data-analyse en testdata-extractie.
Kennis van de sector en relevante marktinzichten is een belangrijke troef.




Gewenste kennis en vaardigheden:

Kennis van en ervaring met datavirtualisatie en event-driven architecturen (Kafka, Apache NiFi).
Ervaring met het lezen en begrijpen van Python- en SAS-code.
Kennis van BI-tools zoals MicroStrategy en OBI, inclusief de mogelijkheden en beperkingen.
Ervaring met het definiëren en bouwen van dashboards en rapportages.
Begrip van unstructured data en grote datavolumes, inclusief technieken om hiermee om te gaan.
Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een Scrum-framework is een pluspunt.
Kennis van ETL-tools zoals ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.




Locatie & werkomgeving

Opdracht bij de klant in Brussel.
1 à 2 dagen per week onsite.
Consultancy-opdracht.




Taalvereisten

Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en kunt je goed uitdrukken in het Engels.




Ben jij de data-analist die we zoeken? Solliciteer dan nu en word onderdeel van een dynamisch team dat bijdraagt aan de digitale transformatie!

Show more

Ben jij de data-analist die we zoeken? Solliciteer dan nu en word onderdeel van een dynamisch team dat bijdraagt aan de digitale transformatie!

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

About Devoteam:

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise. 

For 30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.

With 11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe

At Devoteam, tech is in our DNA, and it’s the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we’re ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels. 

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.

  6. Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Data Analyst - Data & AI
Description:
Ben je gepassioneerd door data & analyse en krijg jij energie van het bouwen van Power BI dashboards met oog voor design die relevante informatie helder voorstellen? Werk je bovendien graag mee aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Dan is een rol als Power BI Data Analyst binnen ons Data & AI team misschien interessant voor jou!


In je rol als Power BI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collega’s aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten. Deze projecten worden voornamelijk in de Microsoft Cloud uitgevoerd.
Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie door gebruiksvriendelijke Power BI dashboards te ontwikkelen.
Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.
Je bent een krak in het geven van demo's aan onze klanten.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam en leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data & AI funteam.


Wat breng jij mee?


Je behaalde een bachelor of master, bij voorkeur op het gebied van (Bedrijfskundige) Informatica of Business IT & Management of een hieraan gerelateerde studierichting.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring opgebouwd als Data Analyst en Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen meer.
Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.
Kennis omtrent het Microsoft Azure Data Analytics Cloud platform is een pluspunt.
Je hebt (of wenst) een Microsoft Certified Professional certificaat.
Kennis van technologie in data engineering en datawarehouses is een plus. Ook kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python is een meerwaarde.
Je bouwt impactvolle dashboards als geen ander én je haalt energie uit storytelling.
Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden (zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels), klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn tevens zeer belangrijk in deze rol.
Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er af en toe van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Diegem, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office!


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?


We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
Je start bij een Top Employer!
Een marktconform loon aangevuld met extralegale voordelen. Een elektrische wagen met laadpas of een mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, een interessante groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, een gsm-abonnement, een forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding, een krachtige laptop en de mogelijkheid om je salarispakket een eigen accent te geven dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan.
Flexibele werkuren én een mooie work/life balans.
Een top team: waarin nieuwe frisse ideeën en initiatieven steeds welkom zijn! Team-events, happy hours en een steeds legendarisch bedrijfsfeest horen daar ook bij.
Begeleiding op maat: doorheen jouw carrière word je begeleid door onze people managers. Zo heb je een aanspreekpunt, een persoonlijke coach én een sparringpartner.
Continu bijleren: door innovation centers, leesgroepen, knowledge sharing meetings, hackatons, deelname aan conferenties en externe opleidingen zetten we kennisdeling en bijleren centraal.
Mogelijkheid tot groei: afhankelijk van je eigen interesses en initiatieven, biedt Cegeka verschillende horizontale en verticale carrièrepaden.
Hybride werken: je werkt vanuit een Cegeka kantoor in jouw buurt (Hasselt, Leuven, Diegem, Antwerpen, Gent), gecombineerd met on site aanwezigheid bij de klant en thuiswerk.
We hechten waarde aan duurzaamheid door CO2-neutraliteit na te streven met de elektrificatie van ons wagenpark en een milieuvriendelijk datacenter. We ontwikkelen innovatieve oplossingen met een positieve impact op milieu, mens en maatschappij, en streven naar een inclusieve en diverse werkomgeving waarin iedereen gewaardeerd en gehoord wordt.


Aspire to more: onze belofte aan jou

Je krijgt bij Cegeka alle ruimte om jezelf als professional verder te ontwikkelen. Samen realiseren we wat je écht wil betekenen voor onze klanten en collega’s. We nodigen je graag uit om met ons mee te groeien. In een ongekende veelzijdigheid aan uitdagende, betekenisvolle IT-projecten. Zet je stempel op projecten voor aansprekende klanten waarbij we het verschil maken. Aspire to more.

Intensief, met veel plezier en betrokkenheid. We werken hier altijd met elkaar samen, in close cooperation met collega’s én met de klant. Binnen een cultuur, gedreven door onze waarden: eigenaarschap, persoonlijke ontwikkeling, respect en authenticiteit. Kom deel uitmaken van de volgende fase van een succesvol, snelgroeiend en innovatief internationaal IT-bedrijf.


Show more
HTML:
Ben je gepassioneerd door data & analyse en krijg jij energie van het bouwen van Power BI dashboards met oog voor design die relevante informatie helder voorstellen? Werk je bovendien graag mee aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Dan is een rol als Power BI Data Analyst binnen ons Data & AI team misschien interessant voor jou!

  • In je rol als Power BI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collega’s aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten. Deze projecten worden voornamelijk in de Microsoft Cloud uitgevoerd.
  • Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie door gebruiksvriendelijke Power BI dashboards te ontwikkelen.
  • Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
  • Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.
  • Je bent een krak in het geven van demo's aan onze klanten.
  • Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
  • Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam en leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data & AI funteam.

Wat breng jij mee?

  • Je behaalde een bachelor of master, bij voorkeur op het gebied van (Bedrijfskundige) Informatica of Business IT & Management of een hieraan gerelateerde studierichting.
  • Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring opgebouwd als Data Analyst en Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen meer.
  • Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.
  • Kennis omtrent het Microsoft Azure Data Analytics Cloud platform is een pluspunt.
  • Je hebt (of wenst) een Microsoft Certified Professional certificaat.
  • Kennis van technologie in data engineering en datawarehouses is een plus. Ook kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python is een meerwaarde.
  • Je bouwt impactvolle dashboards als geen ander én je haalt energie uit storytelling.
  • Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden (zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels), klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn tevens zeer belangrijk in deze rol.
  • Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er af en toe van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Diegem, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office!

Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

  • We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
  • Je start bij een Top Employer!
  • Een marktconform loon aangevuld met extralegale voordelen. Een elektrische wagen met laadpas of een mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, een interessante groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, een gsm-abonnement, een forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding, een krachtige laptop en de mogelijkheid om je salarispakket een eigen accent te geven dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan.
  • Flexibele werkuren én een mooie work/life balans.
  • Een top team: waarin nieuwe frisse ideeën en initiatieven steeds welkom zijn! Team-events, happy hours en een steeds legendarisch bedrijfsfeest horen daar ook bij.
  • Begeleiding op maat: doorheen jouw carrière word je begeleid door onze people managers. Zo heb je een aanspreekpunt, een persoonlijke coach én een sparringpartner.
  • Continu bijleren: door innovation centers, leesgroepen, knowledge sharing meetings, hackatons, deelname aan conferenties en externe opleidingen zetten we kennisdeling en bijleren centraal.
  • Mogelijkheid tot groei: afhankelijk van je eigen interesses en initiatieven, biedt Cegeka verschillende horizontale en verticale carrièrepaden.
  • Hybride werken: je werkt vanuit een Cegeka kantoor in jouw buurt (Hasselt, Leuven, Diegem, Antwerpen, Gent), gecombineerd met on site aanwezigheid bij de klant en thuiswerk.
  • We hechten waarde aan duurzaamheid door CO2-neutraliteit na te streven met de elektrificatie van ons wagenpark en een milieuvriendelijk datacenter. We ontwikkelen innovatieve oplossingen met een positieve impact op milieu, mens en maatschappij, en streven naar een inclusieve en diverse werkomgeving waarin iedereen gewaardeerd en gehoord wordt.


Aspire to more: onze belofte aan jou

Je krijgt bij Cegeka alle ruimte om jezelf als professional verder te ontwikkelen. Samen realiseren we wat je écht wil betekenen voor onze klanten en collega’s. We nodigen je graag uit om met ons mee te groeien. In een ongekende veelzijdigheid aan uitdagende, betekenisvolle IT-projecten. Zet je stempel op projecten voor aansprekende klanten waarbij we het verschil maken. Aspire to more.

Intensief, met veel plezier en betrokkenheid. We werken hier altijd met elkaar samen, in close cooperation met collega’s én met de klant. Binnen een cultuur, gedreven door onze waarden: eigenaarschap, persoonlijke ontwikkeling, respect en authenticiteit. Kom deel uitmaken van de volgende fase van een succesvol, snelgroeiend en innovatief internationaal IT-bedrijf.

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance
Description:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST - INSURANCE SECTOR

Your Role & Work Environment

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in fostering a data-driven culture within a leading company in the insurance sector. Your mission will be to support business teams by providing valuable insights that enhance decision-making processes and optimize customer interactions.

You will be part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, collaborating with professionals across various domains to develop impactful analytical solutions. Your work will focus on creating automated dashboards, conducting deep dives into customer behaviors, and generating advanced reports to drive strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Translating Business Needs into Analytical Solutions


Engage with stakeholders to understand and challenge business requirements.
Assess feasibility, define clear objectives, and set realistic timelines.
Ensure data availability and design a suitable analytical approach, effectively communicating your methodology to stakeholders.


Data Analysis & Execution


Conduct in-depth analysis on customer data to address business questions.
Perform customer behavior analysis and develop predictive models.
Create advanced ad-hoc reports using tools such as SQL, Cognos, and Adobe Analytics.


Delivering Insights & Recommendations


Use data visualization techniques to communicate findings effectively.
Adapt messaging and storytelling to suit different audiences.
Provide clear, data-driven recommendations while considering data privacy regulations.


What We Are Looking For

We seek a proactive, analytical, and results-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. You should have a strong ability to translate business needs into actionable data insights while maintaining a critical and strategic mindset.

Required Qualifications & Skills


Master's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, with at least 2 years in the insurance sector.
Strong SQL skills (mandatory).
Experience with analytical tools such as SAS, Cognos, or Adobe Analytics (preferred).
Ability to influence stakeholders through data-driven insights.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong analytical mindset.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).


What We Offer


A dynamic, fast-paced environment where innovation and collaboration drive success.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development in data analytics.
A work culture that values ownership, creativity, and analytical excellence.
The chance to work on strategic projects with high business impact.


If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and have experience in the insurance sector, we would love to hear from you!

Apply Now

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025
Description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.



Your profile

We Are Looking For Someone Who


Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Is eligible for security clearance.



Success In This Role Often Comes Down To


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.



Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.



Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Als Beheerder Klantselectie ben jij de schakel tussen de marketingafdeling en onze klanten. Jouw kernactiviteit is het selecteren van de juiste doelgroepen voor de marketingcampagnes, op basis van klantendata. Je zorgt ervoor dat de communicatie in de juiste brievenbussen terechtkomt, door de klantendatabase te analyseren en de juiste regio’s te bepalen.




Concreet houdt dit in:




Het selecteren van doelgroepen op basis van klantendata voor gerichte marketingcampagnes.
Samenwerken met de marketingafdeling om te bepalen welke informatie nodig is en hoe we deze het best kunnen verspreiden.
Het onderzoeken van de kosten van bus-aan-busbedelingen en het terugkoppelen van de prijs aan de klant.
Het afhandelen van gemeentelijke taksen en zorgen voor tijdige betalingen.
Het beheren van productrecalls door te onderzoeken welke klanten betrokken zijn en hen zo snel mogelijk te informeren.




Kennis en ervaring: Je hebt administratieve ervaring en leert snel nieuwe computerprogramma’s. Kennis van Excel en SAP is een plus.

Communicatief: Je kan ideeën, suggesties en gedachten duidelijk overbrengen aan collega’s, klanten en partners.

Analytisch vermogen: Je kunt grote hoeveelheden data verwerken en de juiste conclusies trekken.

Strategisch denken: Je hebt een goed conceptueel denkvermogen en legt vlot verbanden.

Stressbestendigheid: Je blijft kalm, zelfs onder druk, en weet krappe deadlines te halen.




Talenkennis: Je hebt een vlotte communicatie in het Nederlands.




What's in it for you?

Een projectcontract van 6 maand met allerhande extralegale voordelen (maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, bedrijfswagen optie, groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering)

Title: Research & Data Intern
Company: Long Duration Energy Storage Council (LDES Council)
Description:
Research & Data Intern




About the LDES Council

The Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) Council is a global non-profit organization with founding members and a Board made up of executives and business leaders from leading energy companies, technology providers, investors and end-users. The LDES Council advances the decarbonisation of our world through the acceleration of long duration energy storage by providing member-driven, fact-based guidance and research on the deployment of long-duration energy storage for society's benefit.

Launched on November 4, 2021 at COP26, the LDES Council is rapidly growing and has established itself as a catalyst in driving global dialogues on long duration storage by providing fact-based guidance and information drawn from members’ expertise.




We are now seeking a Research & Data Intern to support our work tracking LDES projects, analyzing industry trends, and contributing to key research initiatives.




Position: Research & Data Intern

Location: Remote (+/- 3 hours Central European Timezone)

Employment Type: Paid internship (Full-time, 6 months with a possibility to extend)

Role Overview

The Research & Data Intern will play a vital role in managing and updating the LDES Council’s global project tracker, supporting industry research, and contributing to the development of key Council publications. This internship is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about clean energy, data management, and technology research who is looking to gain hands-on experience in the industry.




Key Responsibilities

Project Tracker & Data Management

Maintain and update the global LDES project tracker, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Organize and enter project data, identifying and filling gaps
Conduct research to track new projects, funding announcements, and technology deployments.
Work with external partners to innovate on developing a new format for the tracker.

Database & Research Support

Work with Excel, Google Sheets, and other database tools to manage energy storage project data.
Assist in data gathering, cleaning, and analysis for internal reports and publications.
Support research on energy storage technologies, policies, and industry trends.

Technology Lookbook & Content Creation

Assist in updating and formatting the LDES Technology Lookbook with clear, visually appealing content.
Support the development of research-based materials, including reports, presentations, and white papers.

Industry Research & Monitoring

Monitor and track new energy storage projects, policy developments, and market trends.
Summarize key findings for internal discussions, presentations, and external reports.
Compile industry insights from various sources to inform Council initiatives.

General Support & Learning Opportunities

Assist with outreach to industry stakeholders to gather project data and insights.
Support team projects related to energy storage research, data tracking, and member engagement.
Contribute ideas to improve research methodologies, workflows, and Council initiatives.
Gain exposure to industry leaders, emerging technologies, and key policy discussions, providing a valuable opportunity for learning and career development within the organization.




Ideal Skills & Qualifications

Comfortable working with data management and analysis tools (Excel, Google Sheets, or similar).
Strong research and analytical skills, with the ability to summarize complex information clearly.
Interest in energy, sustainability, and emerging technologies.
High attention to detail and ability to organize large datasets.
Willingness to learn, take initiative, and collaborate in a fast-paced environment.
Educational background or experience in energy, engineering, policy, or data analytics is a plus.




Don’t meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building an inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply.




Why Join the LDES Council?

· Full time, permanent, salaried, benefits-eligible, exempt status

· Remote, collaborative culture

· Healthcare provided by LDES Council for individual, including medical, dental, vision insurance; family insurance available

· 401k contribution with matching contributions (in the US)

· Flexible paid time off, including your birthday!

· Paid parental leave

· Technology stipend for home office

· Global travel opportunities

Application Process

Interested candidates should submit:

A current CV (max 2 pages)
A short letter outlining your motivation and how you meet the requirements for the role




Please email your application to careers@ldescouncil.com using the subject line: “Recruiting: Research & Data Intern."

Show more

Don’t meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building an inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply.


Why Join the LDES Council?

· Full time, permanent, salaried, benefits-eligible, exempt status

· Remote, collaborative culture

· Healthcare provided by LDES Council for individual, including medical, dental, vision insurance; family insurance available

· 401k contribution with matching contributions (in the US)

· Flexible paid time off, including your birthday!

· Paid parental leave

· Technology stipend for home office

· Global travel opportunities

Application Process

Interested candidates should submit:

  • A current CV (max 2 pages)
  • A short letter outlining your motivation and how you meet the requirements for the role


Please email your application to careers@ldescouncil.com using the subject line: “Recruiting: Research & Data Intern."

Title: Senior BI Data Analyst
HTML:
pawaTech is looking for a Senior BI Data Analyst with a strong commitment to teamwork and a collaborative mindset. You will be part of the Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse team, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of financial reporting while developing tools to support internal and external stakeholders. In this role, you will work closely with finance and compliance teams, provide actionable insights, and contribute to reporting processes for country-level operations as we expand into new markets.


About us:

pawaTech is a leading iGaming solutions provider, delivering sportsbook, casino, lottery, and player management software as a service. We power betPawa - Africa’s largest betting brand, operating across multiple markets.


Our platform is designed for scale, handling millions of active users across web and mobile, processing thousands of transactions every second. With nearly a decade of industry expertise, we don’t just build software - we craft tailored solutions that drive innovation. Our expertise, commitment to quality, and client-focused approach make us a trusted partner in Africa and beyond.


What you’ll be doing:

  • Ensuring accurate and reliable financial reporting;
  • Developing reporting tools for external stakeholders like regulators and tax authorities;
  • Supporting financial audits with accurate data;
  • Collaborating with finance compliance and data warehouse teams;
  • Conducting ad-hoc analyses to support business and financial decisions;
  • Building and maintaining dashboards and data visualisations to communicate insights effectively;
  • Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, ensuring data-driven decision-making;
  • Performing quality checks and delivering country-level financial reporting as we expand.


What makes you a great candidate:

  • At least 5 years of experience working in data analytics, business intelligence, or a related field;
  • Strong proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation;
  • Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Knowledge of Python for data manipulation and analysis;
  • Basic understanding of finance or financial reporting (beneficial);
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related discipline (Mathematics, Business, Engineering, and any scientific field with data handling);
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with cross-functional teams;
  • Familiarity with ClickHouse is beneficial.


Why choose pawaTech?

  • We make an impact and contribute to shaping of the iGaming culture;
  • We offer growth inside dedicated teams of seniors and career prospects;
  • We embrace modern technological stack and innovative approach;
  • We value balance - hybrid environment, wellness-related perks and team events are waiting for you;
  • We play it fair with compensation that recognises and backs your achievements, team budgets and recognition milestone bonuses.


This job is accepting ongoing applications and there is no application deadline.



At pawaTech, we are dedicated to building a welcoming and diverse workplace and invite applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, age, or other protected characteristics. Our hiring process ensures fairness, objectivity, and respect for every applicant. Applicants are welcome to redact or omit information from their resumes that identifies their age, date of birth, or dates of attendance or graduation from educational institutions.


In compliance with EU GDPR standards and PDPA in Estonia, your personal data will be treated confidentially, used purely for recruitment, and accessible only to authorised hiring team members. To request data deletion, updates, or transfers, please reach out via data.protection@pawatech.com we will fulfil your request in accordance with applicable data protection laws.

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025
Description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.



Your profile

We Are Looking For Someone Who


Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Is eligible for security clearance.



Success In This Role Often Comes Down To


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.



Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.



Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.




Your job responsibilities:




Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.
Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.




Your Requirements:




Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client’s needs.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.




We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

Title: Fully Remote: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote - anywhere in Belgium




Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification Path:

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements:

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Dutch language
Being a resident of Belgium for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in the Belgium
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion,, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
🔎 Quantitative Analyst




Join a dynamic team at the forefront of energy trading! We’re looking for a Quantitative Analyst to support robust and high-performance quantitative tools that drive real business impact.




Tasks




✔ Collaborate closely with traders to enhance pricing frameworks and risk management strategies

✔ Develop new pricing models and trading strategies for energy markets

✔ Implement best coding practices and contribute to the official pricing library

✔ Deliver tactical and strategic quantitative solutions




Skills




🔹 Strong background in Financial Mathematics (stochastic calculus, Monte Carlo, PDEs, etc.)

🔹 Proficiency in C#, Python, or similar languages

🔹 Ability to explain complex models in a clear, actionable way

🔹 Master’s or PhD in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or Financial Engineering

🔹 Experience in commodity markets is a plus

📍 Fluency in English

Title: Solver - Generative AI Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation, providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services tailored to empower its partners and address their unique challenges. We tackle complex challenges with a holistic approach, fostering collaboration across diverse expertise areas, including Data Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Governance.




Our "Solvers" are passionate professionals empowered by cutting-edge tools, a culture of knowledge sharing, and continuous learning opportunities. We are seeking a Generative AI Specialist to join our team of experts, helping our clients leverage the power of advanced AI technologies to transform their operations.




Your Role:

As a Generative AI Specialist, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative AI solutions, with a particular focus on generative models and their applications.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications (Mandatory)

Educational Background: Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience including at least 2 in the aforementioned specialty
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Skills

Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Collaboration: Engage with clients to identify business needs, explore AI opportunities, and deliver tailored solutions leveraging generative AI.
Use Case Development: Analyze client challenges to propose and implement generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, content creation, or workflow automation.




Technical Implementation

Model Development: Design, build, and fine-tune generative AI models using frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, and Hugging Face.
Agent Design: Create agent-based architectures for real-time decision-making and task automation.
Integration: Connect generative AI systems with external tools, APIs, and enterprise systems to optimize workflow and performance.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and contribute to internal R&D initiatives.
Experiment with emerging models, techniques, and tools to ensure cutting-edge solutions for clients.




Project Management

Plan, execute, and oversee the delivery of AI projects, ensuring timely and high-quality outcomes.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance
Description:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST - INSURANCE SECTOR

Your Role & Work Environment

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in fostering a data-driven culture within a leading company in the insurance sector. Your mission will be to support business teams by providing valuable insights that enhance decision-making processes and optimize customer interactions.

You will be part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, collaborating with professionals across various domains to develop impactful analytical solutions. Your work will focus on creating automated dashboards, conducting deep dives into customer behaviors, and generating advanced reports to drive strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Translating Business Needs into Analytical Solutions


Engage with stakeholders to understand and challenge business requirements.
Assess feasibility, define clear objectives, and set realistic timelines.
Ensure data availability and design a suitable analytical approach, effectively communicating your methodology to stakeholders.


Data Analysis & Execution


Conduct in-depth analysis on customer data to address business questions.
Perform customer behavior analysis and develop predictive models.
Create advanced ad-hoc reports using tools such as SQL, Cognos, and Adobe Analytics.


Delivering Insights & Recommendations


Use data visualization techniques to communicate findings effectively.
Adapt messaging and storytelling to suit different audiences.
Provide clear, data-driven recommendations while considering data privacy regulations.


What We Are Looking For

We seek a proactive, analytical, and results-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. You should have a strong ability to translate business needs into actionable data insights while maintaining a critical and strategic mindset.

Required Qualifications & Skills


Master's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, with at least 2 years in the insurance sector.
Strong SQL skills (mandatory).
Experience with analytical tools such as SAS, Cognos, or Adobe Analytics (preferred).
Ability to influence stakeholders through data-driven insights.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong analytical mindset.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).


What We Offer


A dynamic, fast-paced environment where innovation and collaboration drive success.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development in data analytics.
A work culture that values ownership, creativity, and analytical excellence.
The chance to work on strategic projects with high business impact.


If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and have experience in the insurance sector, we would love to hear from you!

Apply Now

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

Richemont International Distribution (RID) is looking for a highly motivated intern for a 6-month mission to support the Project& Logistics Performance team in optimizing logistics operations and performance analysis.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

This internship will provide you with hands-on experience in logistics performance management and master data. Your key responsibilities will include:


Logistics Reporting Support: Assist in setting up and improving logistics dashboards, ensuring alignment with global KPIs and reporting guidelines.
Performance Analysis: Identify opportunities for improvement by analyzing logistics KPIs, conducting cost studies, and proposing optimization levers.
Support for Periodic Reviews: Assist in daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly logistics performance reviews and help interpret key results.
Continuous Improvement: Participate in logistics optimization projects and develop new methodologies to enhance performance measurement.
Data Management Support: Use BI tools (Power BI, SAP, Celonis, SAC, GCP, Looker) to analyze and visualize logistics performance data.
Documentation and Standardization: Contribute to the structuring and updating of logistics KPI documentation and management routines.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?


You are currently pursuing a Master’s/Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field, with a strong interest in logistics, performance management, and data analysis.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable recommendations.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SAP, SQL and capable of structuring and managing databases.
Good understanding of logistics activities and performance-related challenges.
Proactive and autonomous, with the ability to structure your work and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Detail-oriented and rigorous, able to synthesize and communicate complex analyses effectively.
Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, to collaborate with various internal stakeholders.
Fluent in French and English.


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

At Richemont, we embrace a culture of performance and continuous improvement. We foster diversity, collaboration, and innovation, providing an engaging and dynamic environment to tackle tomorrow’s logistics challenges.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

If your application is selected, we will contact you for an initial discussion. You will then have the opportunity to meet the team and gain insights into the role’s challenges and expectations.

Ready to take on the challenge? Apply now!

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: July 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role


Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.


Your Profil


Currently pursuing a master’s degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.
