You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Title: Internship Data Analyst
Description:
Summary

In our Pharmaceutical Development (PHAD) unit, we are dedicated to advancing and applying cutting-edge pharmaceutical technologies to positively impact patients worldwide through the ongoing creation of novel commercial products.

About The Role

We are currently seeking a skilled intern with a background in programming to contribute to the development to create a digital platform to support product design within PHAD.

This role entails automating data processes, integrating data from diverse data sources, and constructing visualizations to support business decisions.

The ideal candidate will be an innovative problem-solver with experience in data integration, automation, and visualization, and possess programming abilities.

We are looking for a student studying data sciences, computer sciences, bioinformatics or a related degree.

Preferred start date: May 2025

Duration: 6 months

Please attach a cover letter explaining your motivation for this position and let us know when you are available. Thank you very much.

Key Responsibilities


Utilization of various applications, services, or connectors (e.g., Power Apps) to enable data flow automation.
Develop and implement data integration processes to aggregate data from multiple sources into a unified tool for a comprehensive overview.
Ensure efficient data management and effective analysis/reporting to support business goals.
Application of programming for data visualization to visualize data from multiple sources within a single platform.
Development of digital tools to support activities related to environmental sustainability.


Essential Requirements

Education: Recent graduate (B.Sc./M.Sc.) or enrolled Master Student

Languages: Proficiency in English

Experience/Professional Requirements

Programming skills (e.g. Python):


Knowledge in software for data visualization (e.g. Power Bi, Spotfire etc)
Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams in an international environment, strong communication skills


Desirable Requirements

Programming skills and experience with handling and connecting data pools (e.g. Power App, Alteryx)

Why Novartis: Our purpose is to reimagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives and our vision is to become the most valued and trusted medicines company in the world. How can we achieve this? With our people. It is our associates that drive us each day to reach our ambitions. Be a part of this mission and join us! Learn more here: https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams' representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all

individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable

accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed

information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to

diversity.inclusion_ch@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your

contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

We are seeking a Data Analyst (Event Performance) to evaluate event ROI, marketing effectiveness, and attendee data, with a strong focus on blockchain events. This role requires a data-driven professional who can extract insights, optimize event strategies, and measure the impact of marketing efforts. The ideal candidate has extensive experience analyzing event performance and a deep understanding of blockchain industry trends.




Roles & Responsibilities:

Analyze event ROI, attendee behavior, and marketing performance metrics.
Develop data-driven insights to optimize future blockchain events.
Track and assess KPIs related to engagement, conversions, and sponsorship impact.
Collaborate with marketing and event teams to refine strategies based on analytics.
Present data findings through reports, dashboards, and visualizations.




Skills & Qualifications:

10+ years of experience in data analysis, event analytics, or related roles.
5+ years of experience analyzing blockchain event performance.
Proficiency in data analytics tools (Excel, SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, etc.).
Strong understanding of event marketing metrics and audience segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving and data visualization skills.

  • Strong understanding of event marketing metrics and audience segmentation.
  • Excellent problem-solving and data visualization skills.

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%
Description:
Du suchst eine spannende Herausforderung in einem dynamischen, europaweit führenden Unternehmen? Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?

Dann bist du bei uns als




Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%




genau richtig! Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.

Was dich erwartet

Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad hoc Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Aufbereiten grosser Datenmengen
Selbstständige Weiterentwicklung der Reporting-Landschaft
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Pricing-Restrukturierung: Preiskalkulation & Konditionsmanagement
Abweichungsanalysen (Plan-Ist)
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten




Was dich auszeichnet

Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im (Marketing-/Vertriebs-) Controlling
Technisches und analytisches Verständnis
Umfangreiche IT-Kenntnisse (SAP, MS Office)
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch




Was wir bieten

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit deiner erfolgreichen Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.




Wer wir sind

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Kurzum: ein führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.

Wir freuen uns auf deine detaillierte Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) mit Lohnvorstellung, bevorzugt per E-Mail an: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst (all)
Description:
Renewables Structuring & Pricing

50-100%

Ready to play a key role in developing and optimizing pricing models for renewable energy products? You will combine mathematical modeling, programming, and market analysis to deliver innovative solutions for complex business needs.
 
Quantitative Analyst (all)
 
Your responsibilities

Develop and improve pricing models for structured renewable energy products like PPAs
Implement and enhance quantitative models for risk analysis, forecasting, and portfolio optimization
Apply stochastic modeling, Monte Carlo simulations, and time-series forecasting to assess renewable energy portfolios
Automate and optimize pricing tools using Python and SQL
Conduct quantitative market analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and risks
Support structuring teams by providing financial modeling and quantitative insights for contract negotiations

 
Your skills

Master's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, Economics, or a related field
Proficiency in Python for quantitative analysis, modeling, and automation
Strong knowledge of financial principles, statistical modeling, and risk management techniques
Experience with optimization techniques, machine learning, and financial modeling
Background in energy markets, renewable energy project development, or PPA structuring is a plus
Ability to translate complex business needs into technical solutions and provide strategic insights

 
Questions about the application process

Florian Witschi

Recruiting Partner

+41 58 477 55 59

Mark Commerford

Head of Structuring & Pricing

+41 58 477 58 32

We are not interested in enquiries from recruitment agencies.

Apply online at bkw.com/jobs

Title: Global Data Analyst - Sustainability ofi Coffee
Description:
Olam Food Ingredients

Job Description

As global data analyst for the Coffee division, you will have close interaction with our teams of agronomists and sustainability experts across our business. This implies working with a multicultural team in 18 origins (countries). Besides a proven expertise and passion for numbers (and coffee) we are looking for a proactive person willing to take on a big challenge in a dynamic company with plenty of growth opportunities.

What will you work on?


To analyze data related to agricultural practices and sustainability in coffee supply chains in ofi – coffee operations
To coordinate with ofi digital on system upgrades or developments of our data collection platform OFIS
To assist and guide origins teams on the correct use of the OFIS data collection platform
To provide guidance to origins for data collection (design surveys, training material, outlier identification, sample methodologies and monitoring)
To improve data management systems, focusing on data quality
To support data integration between different platforms
To provide periodic analysis reports to the origin teams, focusing on data intelligence and data performance (quality)
To communicate the value of data through dashboards (for central and origin decision making and reporting, and for external stakeholders)
To work on what if scenarios or simulations to forecast outcomes and impacts from sustainability interventions.
To assess GHG emission reduction from the implementation of different practices.
To highlight insights, trends and other findings that help central decision-making processes.
To cover Sustainability Programs data requirements (baselines, impact measurement, using external and internal tools)
To continuously update and communicate global metrics.


Requirements


Bachelor's in engineering, Agroforestry, Business/Economic or similar
Advanced English and Spanish (min. B2)
Minimum 6 months experience in data management and analysis
Knowledge of agriculture and/or sustainability (like yield, seasonal effects)


Technical Knowledge


Statistical and analytical tools (R, Python, or Stata)
Data visualization tools (Power BI)
MS Office tools, advanced Excel
Knowledge in GIS is a plus


Expectations


Good at data management
Meticulous & thorough in transversal analyzing multiple data points
Being Proactive
High motivation to work independently in a multicultural environment
Good social skills, getting the origins on board and equipped.


Availability to travel to coffee operations, if required

By joining ofi you'll become part of one of the most fast-growing and sustainable organizations in food- and agri business. You'll get the responsibilities that fit you and the job, and lots of room for initiative in an open and informal organisation.
Show more

Title: E&C Data Science Internship
Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description:

About the Internship:

Are you a data enthusiast looking to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and fast-paced environment in the Ethics & Compliance (E&C) area? Do you want to develop your skills and knowledge in GenAi and analytics? Would you like to run some experiments with GenAI how to best use the new technology for E&C? We're excited to offer an internship opportunity for students to join our data team as a Ethics & Compliance Intern!

As a member of the data team within E&C, you will have the chance to work alongside our experienced data science and analytics team, supporting various tasks and projects. You will gain exposure to GenAI and analytics in the area of E&C.

What you will be doing here:

You will support our E&C Data Team, dedicated to several compliance topics like monitoring, policies, investigations, transparency and risk management to work on various related tasks including


Run selected GenAI and Analytics experiments to support our E&C business functions
Support to collect business requirements from different E&C functions and design an appropriate solution to fulfill the business needs.
Support an environment & culture of continuous improvement of data solutions and processes to provide valuable and effective solutions to ensure compliance within Takeda.
Support to design a process framework to run GenAI and Analytics applications within Takeda
Support E&C Data Team on ad-hoc new projects and initiatives.


Qualifications:


Currently enrolled in a university program pursuing a degree in Data, Data Science, Informatics, or a related field.
Completed a bachelor.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for learning and growth.
Experience in GenAI development and analytics solutions
Must have Python knowledge incl. common data science packages (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn) and Jupyter Notebook
Nice-to-have Git, a data viz tool such as PowerBI, IDE such as Pycharm/Visual Studio Code
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.
Fluency in English (written and spoken) is required.


What Takeda can offer you:


Hands-on experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Interesting experiments in GenAI and Analytics
Mentorship from experienced data professionals.
Flexible working hours to accommodate your academic schedule.
Opportunity to gain practical skills and build your resume.
Potential for future employment opportunities based on performance.


How to Apply:

If you're a motivated and detail-oriented student looking to gain valuable experience in data and E&C, we encourage you to apply for this exciting internship opportunity!

If you have any questions, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition Partner – Natalia Sadowska -:at Natalia.sadowska@takeda.com.

Application Deadline: 31.March 2025

About Takeda:

At Takeda, we are guided by our purpose of creating better health for people, brighter future for the world.

Every employee plays a role in making sure we – as a Takeda team – can discover and deliver life-transforming treatments, guided by our commitment to patients, our people, and the planet.

People join Takeda because they share in our purpose. And they stay because we’re committed to an inclusive, safe, and empowering work environment that offers exceptional experiences and opportunities for everyone to pursue their own ambitions.

More on https //www.takeda.com/

At Takeda we unite in diversity.:

Takeda is committed to creating an inclusive workplace, where individuals are recognized for the diverse backgrounds and abilities they bring to our company.

We are continually improving workplace experience and accessibility for everyone, and welcome applications from all qualified candidates.

Locations:

Zurich, Switzerland

Worker Type:

Employee

Worker Sub-Type:

Paid Intern (Fixed Term) (Trainee)

Time Type:

Part time

As a member of the data team within E&C, you will have the chance to work alongside our experienced data science and analytics team, supporting various tasks and projects. You will gain exposure to GenAI and analytics in the area of E&C.

What you will be doing here:

You will support our E&C Data Team, dedicated to several compliance topics like monitoring, policies, investigations, transparency and risk management to work on various related tasks including

  • Run selected GenAI and Analytics experiments to support our E&C business functions
  • Support to collect business requirements from different E&C functions and design an appropriate solution to fulfill the business needs.
  • Support an environment & culture of continuous improvement of data solutions and processes to provide valuable and effective solutions to ensure compliance within Takeda.
  • Support to design a process framework to run GenAI and Analytics applications within Takeda
  • Support E&C Data Team on ad-hoc new projects and initiatives.

Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a university program pursuing a degree in Data, Data Science, Informatics, or a related field.
  • Completed a bachelor.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for learning and growth.
  • Experience in GenAI development and analytics solutions
  • Must have Python knowledge incl. common data science packages (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn) and Jupyter Notebook
  • Nice-to-have Git, a data viz tool such as PowerBI, IDE such as Pycharm/Visual Studio Code
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.
  • Fluency in English (written and spoken) is required.

What Takeda can offer you:

  • Hands-on experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
  • Interesting experiments in GenAI and Analytics
  • Mentorship from experienced data professionals.
  • Flexible working hours to accommodate your academic schedule.
  • Opportunity to gain practical skills and build your resume.
  • Potential for future employment opportunities based on performance.

How to Apply:

If you're a motivated and detail-oriented student looking to gain valuable experience in data and E&C, we encourage you to apply for this exciting internship opportunity!

If you have any questions, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition Partner – Natalia Sadowska -:at Natalia.sadowska@takeda.com.

Application Deadline: 31.March 2025

About Takeda:

At Takeda, we are guided by our purpose of creating better health for people, brighter future for the world.

Every employee plays a role in making sure we – as a Takeda team – can discover and deliver life-transforming treatments, guided by our commitment to patients, our people, and the planet.

People join Takeda because they share in our purpose. And they stay because we’re committed to an inclusive, safe, and empowering work environment that offers exceptional experiences and opportunities for everyone to pursue their own ambitions.

More on https //www.takeda.com/

At Takeda we unite in diversity.:

Takeda is committed to creating an inclusive workplace, where individuals are recognized for the diverse backgrounds and abilities they bring to our company.

We are continually improving workplace experience and accessibility for everyone, and welcome applications from all qualified candidates.

Locations:

Zurich, Switzerland

Worker Type:

Employee

Worker Sub-Type:

Paid Intern (Fixed Term) (Trainee)

Time Type:

Part time

Title: Sales Controller, Sales Data Analyst (m/f/d) 100%
Description:
Our client GC International AG is one of the leading companies in the development, production, and distribution of a very wide range of oral healthcare and dentistry products. Since its beginning, GC has always embraced innovation and ensured the production of high-quality, pioneering products and services. For its global sales management team, we are looking for an




Sales Controller, Sales Data Analyst (m/f/d) 100%




In this newly created role, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting sales data from various regions, including Europe, USA, Asia, and Japan. Your primary focus will be on enhancing the transparency and accuracy of the sales reporting. You will work closely with regional sales teams and other stakeholders to consolidate data and provide actionable insights.

As Sales Controller, you can analyze complex data sets and use data systems (ERP) to gain actionable insights that support strategic decision making around pricing and sales performance.




Main Responsibilities




Data Analysis: Analyze sales data from data systems (SAP, Power BI, Tableau, and Excel) to identify trends, pricing strategies, and margins.
Reporting: Prepare monthly and quarterly reports for the board, focusing on KPIs and sales analytics.
System Development: Further develop the ERP and reporting systems to create a unified and transparent reporting structure.
Collaboration: Work closely with peers in regional organizations and other stakeholders to gather and consolidate data.
Team Management: Supervise and guide a junior Sales Coordinator in data collection and consolidation.




Your Qualifications

Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field.
Relevant experience in finance, sales analysis, or controlling.
Experience working in an intercultural environment.
Experience in project management.




What we are looking for:




Analytical Mindset: Strong affinity for numbers and structured work approach.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Excel. Familiarity with ERP systems, particularly SAP.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders; capable of enforcing transparency and cooperation from regional organizations.
Pragmatic and Detail-Oriented: Focused on continuous improvement and optimizing processes and tools.
Independent and Self-Motivated: Highly independent and driven by the challenge of optimizing systems and processes.




Do you want to become part of an international company with more than 100 years of commitment and legacy for dental and oral care innovations? Join the team on a transformative journey where innovation meets data-driven success. In this role, you thrive in an intercultural, international environment and can make a significant impact on sales analytics and price strategies.







GC International AG is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates.




Please send us your application documents by email to backoffice@debord.ch, for the attention of Ms. Andrea Nienaber, Managing Partner DE BORD INTERNATIONAL. Discretion is a matter of course.







DE BORD INTERNATIONAL • Zürichbergstrasse 38 • CH-8044 Zürich • Telefon +41 44 382 17 17 • backoffice@debord.ch • www.debord.ch • www.lladvisorygroup.com

Title: Data Science Internship (12 months)
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.

Transforming Waste into Value

At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers; we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

Job Description

The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:


Support the specification of technical requirements and technical design of machine learning based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).


Qualifications


Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning


Additional Information

We offer


Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Excellent employment conditions
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
Modern infrastructure


For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.

Title: Data Analys - BigQuery Specialist
Description:
FORFIRM is providing solutions to real business challenges for our clients through innovation and deep industry understanding. We pride ourselves on being a knowledge-based company, with no barriers or pre-built solutions – we listen to our clients and solve their unique problems.




At FORFIRM, we are looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to join our lively international team and work on projects for Europe's leading brands!




Responsibility

Implementation and monitoring of data to ensure integrity and accuracy.
Development and maintenance of data quality reports.
Design of logical and conceptual data models to meet business requirements.
Collaboration with data architects and developers.
Analysis of large datasets to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate on strategic data projects for BANK clients and serve as the primary contact for data preparation.
Take the lead in overseeing various technical reporting areas, including responsibility for enhancing the CRM data mart, data modeling, data governance and compliance reporting, and conceptualizing and implementing financial accounting reporting




Skills required

Degree in engineering or physics required
Several years of professional experience in the field of banking / financial services in the field of DWH / reporting
Knowledge of PL / SQL and BigQuery
Phyton script language experience
Knowledge of Power BI or similar BI tools
Organizational and conceptual skills as well as a structured and independent way of working
High service orientation and quality awareness in a very dynamic environment
Commitment to a culture of inclusion and appreciation of diverse perspectives

Title: Data Business Analyst - Private Assets (Data Solutions)
Description:
Job Description:

Data Business Analyst (Private Assets)

We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.

Skills/Experience Required:

Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
Rigorous and analytical mindset
Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
Excellent attention to details
Very good communicator
Resistance to pressure and changing environment
Fluent in French and English

Responsibilities:

Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering & modelling techniques, business cases
Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy’s most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we’re as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004, Qim info est implantée en Suisse 🇨🇭 (Genève, Lausanne, Zurich & Bâle) et en France 🇫🇷 (Annecy, Lyon & Paris). Appartenant au groupe MoOngy, l’entreprise bénéficie aussi d’un réseau de développement international 🌐.




3e entreprise informatique de Suisse romande (ICT Journal), Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un système d’information sur différents métiers (Études & Développement 💻, Fonctionnel 🔧, Infrastructures & Réseaux 🌐, Data 📊, DevOps 🚀...) et différents secteurs d’activités (Banque 🏦, Finance 💰, Assurance 📜, Luxe ✨, Retail 🛍️, Aéronautique ✈️...).




Avec plus de 650 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents ! 🌟




En quelques mots 🎯

Nous recrutons actuellement un(e) Data Engineer pour accompagner les équipes de notre client grand compte.




Responsabilités principales :

Définir l’architecture des solutions d’intégration et de distribution de données
Spécifier les normes et les standards d’intégration
Fournir des solutions techniques permettant la collecte, le stockage et le management des données IoT
Superviser les projets d’intégration de données
Concevoir et réaliser les solutions d’intégration de données
Organiser l’orchestration, la synchronisation et le monitoring des chaînes de chargement




Profil recherché :

Expérience en implémentation de chaîne d'extraction et d'intégration de données structurées et semi-structurées
Connaissance d’un outil ETL/ELT tel que Talend
Expérience dans l’intégration d’applications (data hub, enterprise service bus)
Expérience dans l’administration et l’optimisation d’un cluster de messaging (Kafka)
Excellentes connaissances en intégration de données en mode synchrone (appels d’API) et asynchrone (event-based)
Culture software affirmée : DevOps (connaissance de GitLab un plus), développement Agile, principes d’architecture, API
Connaissances des langages SQL, Python et Java un plus
Bonne compréhension des enjeux de l’analytique et de la data science




Les étapes pour nous rencontrer :

Premier contact : Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est à votre écoute pour comprendre votre parcours et vos attentes 🎧.
Entretien technique : Échangez avec un de nos collaborateurs pour parler technique 🛠️.
Entretien avec un Business Manager : Découvrez les missions et projets en détail 🎯.




Pourquoi choisir Qim info ?

Expertise reconnue : Activité dans une dizaine de secteurs et une connaissance des métiers de l’IT 🌐.
Suivi RH & managérial de qualité : Accompagnement dans votre montée en compétences et vos missions au quotidien 🌟.
Culture d’entreprise : Partagez plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim tech talks, soirées annuelles et trimestrielles, Afterwork Qim... de nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année 🎉.
Satisfaction des consultants : Chez Qim info, on est bien et ce sont nos consultants qui le disent mieux que nous sur Glassdoor (note de 4,1/5) 🌟.




Vous souhaitez en savoir plus ? 🔍

Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature !

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst

Commodities Trading

Switzerland

Our client is a leading energy trading firm specializing in electricity, gas, and oil markets. They leverage quantitative models to optimize trading and risk management.

They are seeking a Senior Quantitative Analyst with a PhD (preferred) and extensive commodities trading experience. This role focuses on developing VaR models, analyzing KPIs, and optimizing risk strategies. Strong Python programming skills and deep market understanding are essential.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and refine risk models, including VaR calculations.
Analyze energy market structures to enhance strategies.
Work with trading and risk teams to improve model performance.
Implement quantitative models and algorithms in Python.
Assess KPIs and valuation methodologies.




Key Requirements

Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related field. PhD preferred.
Several years of experience in a commodities trading firm.
Expertise in VaR modelling and risk assessment.
Strong Python programming skills.
Deep understanding of energy markets and pricing structures.
Ability to collaborate with trading and risk teams.

Show more

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Senior Quant Analyst - Front Office - Desk Quant / Strat - Rates




Geneva, Switzerland




200,000 + CHF plus Generous Bonus & excellent benefits package




Overview

Leading Global Investment Manager experiencing significant business growth and has created a new opportunity for a Desk Quant/Strat.
Supporting the Trading Desks, you will work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, helping them understand Risk/PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and using/enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).
The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX – with some exposure to Credit and Equity. There will also be regular dialogue with risk managers and other departments.




Key Skills & Experience

5 - 10 years hands-on experience as a Front Office Rates Quant/Strat
Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate markets and analytics
Good degree in a quantitative discipline
Strong Python & Excel/VBA skills
SQL experience is expected.
Experience with C++, ML / AI would be a major advantage.




The role

Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools.
Potential to develop core analytics library.
Regular dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary

HTML:
Senior Quant Analyst - Front Office - Desk Quant / Strat - Rates


Geneva, Switzerland


200,000 + CHF plus Generous Bonus & excellent benefits package


Overview

  • Leading Global Investment Manager experiencing significant business growth and has created a new opportunity for a Desk Quant/Strat.
  • Supporting the Trading Desks, you will work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, helping them understand Risk/PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and using/enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).
  • The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX – with some exposure to Credit and Equity. There will also be regular dialogue with risk managers and other departments.


Key Skills & Experience

  • 5 - 10 years hands-on experience as a Front Office Rates Quant/Strat
  • Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate markets and analytics
  • Good degree in a quantitative discipline
  • Strong Python & Excel/VBA skills
  • SQL experience is expected.
  • Experience with C++, ML / AI would be a major advantage.


The role

  • Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
  • Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools.
  • Potential to develop core analytics library.
  • Regular dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Big Data/ PySpark Engineer – 600 - 675 CHF Per Day – 6 Month Contract (Likely Extensions) – Investment Banking – Zurich (Hybrid)




Role & Responsibilities:

Conceptualize and design big data system involving Hadoop, PySpark, Hive.
Design functional and technical architectures
Develop applications on the big data platform using open source programming languages
Work closely with Administrator, Architect and Developers




Technical Requirements:

10+ years of IT experience with in-depth big data technology
Extensively worked on Python and pyspark Programming
Experience in building complex data pipelines using Spark and especially PySpark
Experience in performance tuning Spark application.
Experience in scheduling and running spark applications.
Experience in Airflow, Databricks & Azure is added plus
Hands-on experience with fundamental Hadoop tools and technologies
Knowledge on Cluster management and storage mechanism in Big Data Cloud




Rate/ Duration:

600 - 675 CHF
6 months (likely extensions)
Zurich, Switzerland

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer to help us implement new data sets and migrate existing data sets to our on-premises data lake, which will eventually migrate to the cloud.




We are looking for a Senior Data Analytics Engineer who can take ownership of tasks, deliver stable, incremental changes frequently, and ensure thorough testing to maintain high-quality standards




This role is only suitable for candidates based in Switzerland, or looking to relocate.




Tasks:




• Develop required code for end-to-end data pipelines with optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. Incorporate business rules and functional capabilities, security, data retention requirements, etc.

• Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed design.

• Participate and contribute to overall data architecture and design.

• Work with stakeholders including business area sponsors, product owners, data architects, data engineers, project managers, and business analysts to assist them with their data-related technical issues and support their data needs.

• Ensure effective design and development of system architectures through frequent product deliveries, employing effective governance methods for transparency and communication.

• Remain up to date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve the quality of your output.

• Interact with the business to identify, capture, and analyse business requirement




Requirements:




• Minimum of 7 years of work experience in modern data technologies as a Data Analytics Engineer or similar role.

• Experience in building data ingestion pipelines for data warehouse and/or data lake architecture. As well as strong experience in data modelling, design patterns, and building highly scalable applications.

• Hands-on development using open-source data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, HBase, Kafka, Impala, ELK, etc., preferably with Cloudera.

• Experience working with relational databases such as Oracle, SQL Server, etc.

• Strong experience with Python.

• Proficiency in English

Show more

Title: Intern - PiBS Data Analytics (m/f)
Description:
Job Description Summary

Anmerkung: Dieses Praktikum richtet sich ausschliesslich an Studierende, die an der ZHAW oder FHNW im Rahmen des praxisintegrierten Bachelorstudiums (PiBS) in einem Teilzeitpensum von 40% einen Bachelorabschluss anstreben.

Als Mitglied des Fleet Services (FS) Analytics Teams in der Gas Power Engineering Organisation würdest du mit Hilfe von statistischen Methoden und Daten Analysen Erkenntnisse liefern für die herausfordernsten Probleme unserer Ingenieur Teams. Zusätzlich würdest du uns dabei unterstützen die Zuverlässigkeit zu verbessern für die am besten laufende Kraftwerks-Flotte der Welt.

Note: This internship is intended only for students who would like to pursue Bachelor's degree at the University of Applied Sciences (ZHAW or FHNW), under the Practice-integrated Bachelor's degree (PiBS) on a part-time 40% basis.

As a member of the Fleet Services (FS) Analytics team in the Gas Power Engineering organization, you would use statistical methods and data analysis to provide insights into our engineering teams' most challenging problems. In addition, you would help us improve reliability for the best running power plant fleet in the world.

Job Description


Du wertest Messdaten aus und erstellst Modelle mit Hilfe von state-of-the art Technologien, mit dem Ziel die Ursachen und Signaturen zu finden von Anomalien der überwachten Kraftwerks Flotte.
Du wirst Analytics entwickeln, testen und installieren mit Hilfe von Python für das GE Vernova M&D Center
Du wirst KPIs entwickeln und darstellen für ein noch besseren Geschäftseinblick vom Laufverhalten der GE Vernova Flotte
Du arbeitest eng mit Kunden zusammen um Anforderungen zu ermitteln und funktionale und technische Dokumentation zu erstellen
Du wirst bei uns einen Einblick in Software Best Practices und Lean-Management erhalten sowie die Möglichkeit bekommen dein erlerntes wissen aktiv mit einzubringen


Dein Profil


Du hast die Eidgenössische (Berufs-)Matura
Du möchtest ein praxisintegriertes Bachelorstudium (PiBS) in Teilzeit an der FHNW/ ZHAW studieren und unser Team auf einer 40%-Basis unterstützen
Du sprichst fliessend Deutsch und hast sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
Es wäre von Vorteil wenn du schon Programmierkenntnisse in Python und/oder Spark hast
Du bist lernbereit und hast eine vorliebe für’s Optimieren
Du arbeitest gerne im Team, bist verantwortungsbewusst und hast Lust auf eine dynamische und globalle Organisation
Du bist jemand der Lösungsorientiert arbeit


Job Description


You will analyze measurement data and build models using state-of-the-art technologies to find root causes and signatures of anomalies in the monitored power plant fleet.
You will develop, test and install analytics using Python for the GE Vernova Monitoring & Diagnostics Center
You will develop and present KPIs for an even better business insight of the running behavior of the GE Vernova fleet
You will work closely with customers to identify requirements and create functional and technical documentation
You will gain insight into software best practices and lean management and get the opportunity to actively contribute your learned knowledge


Your profile


You have a federal (vocational) high school diploma
You would like to study a practice-integrated Bachelor's degree (PiBS) part-time at the FHNW/ ZHAW and support our team on a 40% basis
You are fluent in German and have a very good command of English
It would be an advantage if you already have programming skills in Python and/or Spark
You are willing to learn and have a passion for optimization
You enjoy working in a team, are responsible and have a desire for a dynamic and global organization
You are someone who is solution-oriented


Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No
Show more

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
  • Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making. 

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

How You Can Make An Impact


Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent



What We Are Looking For:

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently



Consulting and Communication Skills:


Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops



Technical Expertise:


Strong Engineering and/or Mathematics background
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre Future Employeur

Notre client est une prestigieuse institution financière à Genève.

Votre Mission

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez responsable de la collecte, de l’analyse et de l’interprétation de données stratégiques afin de soutenir la prise de décision dans l’entreprise. Vous manipulerez des volumes de données importants, développerez des visualisations et rapports sur mesure, et fournirez des analyses détaillées pour améliorer les performances et les processus internes. Vous participerez également à la mise en œuvre et au suivi des pratiques de gouvernance des données. .

Missions Principales


Gestion des données :
Analyser les données à intégrer dans l’entrepôt de données (DataWareHouse) et définir les règles métier associées.
Effectuer la maintenance analytique du DWH.
Fournir des analyses et rapports à destination des équipes métiers.
Création de rapports et outils décisionnels :
Développer des tableaux de bord, visualisations et rapports interactifs à l’aide de Power BI.
Mettre à disposition des ensembles de données dédiés aux besoins métiers.
Optimisation et gouvernance des données :
Identifier les opportunités d’amélioration dans les processus de collecte et d’exploitation des données.
Contribuer activement à la gouvernance des données et à la gestion du catalogue de données.
Assurer une veille technologique pour intégrer les meilleures pratiques et outils.

Requirements

Profil recherché :


Formation : Diplôme en statistiques, informatique, mathématiques ou domaine associé.
Expérience :
Plus de 4 ans dans un rôle similaire, au sein d’environnements bancaires ou financiers.
Expérience dans l’utilisation d’outils de Business Intelligence et de bases de données complexes.
Connaissance approfondie des problématiques liées à la gestion et à la gouvernance des données.
Expérience dans le secteur bancaire impérative.
Compétences personnelles :
Solides capacités analytiques et rigueur.
Autonomie et capacité à anticiper les besoins.
Esprit novateur et curiosité pour les technologies émergentes.
Compétences techniques requises :
Maîtrise de MS SQL Server et Power BI, bonnes connaissances Dynamics estun plus
Une expérience avec les outils Azure est un plus.

Vous vous épanouirez dans cette organisation si vous possédez:


Un haut niveau de professionnalisme et de sens des responsabilités
Une approche proactive et agile
Un fort esprit d'équipe


Benefits

Ce qui est proposé :


L’opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise établie et prestigieuse
Flexibilité, avantages exceptionnels et un excellent environnement de travail

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

Type: Full-Time

Start Date - ASAP

Location – Geneva, Switzerland




JOB DESCRIPTION:




My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).




DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.

The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.




Duties will involve:

Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
Potential to develop core analytics library
Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required




EXPERIENCE:




5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
Good degree in a quantitative discipline




TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Essential

Python
Excel/VBA




Desirable

C++
ML / AI
SQL

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Experience with Pandas or Polars (Dataframes), SQLAlchemy (database toolkit), Streamlit is a plus.
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Good understanding of NoSQL databases: Apache Solr, MongoDB.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organisational skills.
Technical expertise in data mining and modelling techniques.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning models.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub

Title: Data Science Internship (12 months)
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.

Transforming Waste into Value

At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers; we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

Job Description

The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:


Support the specification of technical requirements and technical design of machine learning based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).


Qualifications


Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning


Additional Information

We offer


Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Excellent employment conditions
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
Modern infrastructure


For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.
