Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

Job Description

The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:

  • Support the specification of technical requirements and technical design of machine learning based products.
  • Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
  • Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
  • Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
  • Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
  • Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
  • Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
  • Good command of English
  • Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning

Additional Information

We offer

  • Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
  • Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
  • Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
  • Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
  • Excellent employment conditions
  • Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
  • Modern infrastructure

For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.

Title: Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

Activités

Job Dimension:

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:


Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat


Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Data Analys - BigQuery Specialist
Description:
FORFIRM is providing solutions to real business challenges for our clients through innovation and deep industry understanding. We pride ourselves on being a knowledge-based company, with no barriers or pre-built solutions – we listen to our clients and solve their unique problems.




At FORFIRM, we are looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to join our lively international team and work on projects for Europe's leading brands!




Responsibility

Implementation and monitoring of data to ensure integrity and accuracy.
Development and maintenance of data quality reports.
Design of logical and conceptual data models to meet business requirements.
Collaboration with data architects and developers.
Analysis of large datasets to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate on strategic data projects for BANK clients and serve as the primary contact for data preparation.
Take the lead in overseeing various technical reporting areas, including responsibility for enhancing the CRM data mart, data modeling, data governance and compliance reporting, and conceptualizing and implementing financial accounting reporting




Skills required

Degree in engineering or physics required
Several years of professional experience in the field of banking / financial services in the field of DWH / reporting
Knowledge of PL / SQL and BigQuery
Phyton script language experience
Knowledge of Power BI or similar BI tools
Organizational and conceptual skills as well as a structured and independent way of working
High service orientation and quality awareness in a very dynamic environment
Commitment to a culture of inclusion and appreciation of diverse perspectives




Show more

Title: Data Business Analyst - Private Assets (Data Solutions)
Description:
Job Description:

Data Business Analyst (Private Assets)

We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.

Skills/Experience Required:

Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
Rigorous and analytical mindset
Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
Excellent attention to details
Very good communicator
Resistance to pressure and changing environment
Fluent in French and English

Responsibilities:

Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering & modelling techniques, business cases
Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy’s most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we’re as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004, Qim info est implantée en Suisse 🇨🇭 (Genève, Lausanne, Zurich & Bâle) et en France 🇫🇷 (Annecy, Lyon & Paris). Appartenant au groupe MoOngy, l’entreprise bénéficie aussi d’un réseau de développement international 🌐.




3e entreprise informatique de Suisse romande (ICT Journal), Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un système d’information sur différents métiers (Études & Développement 💻, Fonctionnel 🔧, Infrastructures & Réseaux 🌐, Data 📊, DevOps 🚀...) et différents secteurs d’activités (Banque 🏦, Finance 💰, Assurance 📜, Luxe ✨, Retail 🛍️, Aéronautique ✈️...).




Avec plus de 650 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents ! 🌟




En quelques mots 🎯

Nous recrutons actuellement un(e) Data Engineer pour accompagner les équipes de notre client grand compte.




Responsabilités principales :

Définir l’architecture des solutions d’intégration et de distribution de données
Spécifier les normes et les standards d’intégration
Fournir des solutions techniques permettant la collecte, le stockage et le management des données IoT
Superviser les projets d’intégration de données
Concevoir et réaliser les solutions d’intégration de données
Organiser l’orchestration, la synchronisation et le monitoring des chaînes de chargement




Profil recherché :

Expérience en implémentation de chaîne d'extraction et d'intégration de données structurées et semi-structurées
Connaissance d’un outil ETL/ELT tel que Talend
Expérience dans l’intégration d’applications (data hub, enterprise service bus)
Expérience dans l’administration et l’optimisation d’un cluster de messaging (Kafka)
Excellentes connaissances en intégration de données en mode synchrone (appels d’API) et asynchrone (event-based)
Culture software affirmée : DevOps (connaissance de GitLab un plus), développement Agile, principes d’architecture, API
Connaissances des langages SQL, Python et Java un plus
Bonne compréhension des enjeux de l’analytique et de la data science




Les étapes pour nous rencontrer :

Premier contact : Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est à votre écoute pour comprendre votre parcours et vos attentes 🎧.
Entretien technique : Échangez avec un de nos collaborateurs pour parler technique 🛠️.
Entretien avec un Business Manager : Découvrez les missions et projets en détail 🎯.




Pourquoi choisir Qim info ?

Expertise reconnue : Activité dans une dizaine de secteurs et une connaissance des métiers de l’IT 🌐.
Suivi RH & managérial de qualité : Accompagnement dans votre montée en compétences et vos missions au quotidien 🌟.
Culture d’entreprise : Partagez plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim tech talks, soirées annuelles et trimestrielles, Afterwork Qim... de nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année 🎉.
Satisfaction des consultants : Chez Qim info, on est bien et ce sont nos consultants qui le disent mieux que nous sur Glassdoor (note de 4,1/5) 🌟.




Vous souhaitez en savoir plus ? 🔍

Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature !

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst

Commodities Trading

Switzerland

Our client is a leading energy trading firm specializing in electricity, gas, and oil markets. They leverage quantitative models to optimize trading and risk management.

They are seeking a Senior Quantitative Analyst with a PhD (preferred) and extensive commodities trading experience. This role focuses on developing VaR models, analyzing KPIs, and optimizing risk strategies. Strong Python programming skills and deep market understanding are essential.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and refine risk models, including VaR calculations.
Analyze energy market structures to enhance strategies.
Work with trading and risk teams to improve model performance.
Implement quantitative models and algorithms in Python.
Assess KPIs and valuation methodologies.




Key Requirements

Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related field. PhD preferred.
Several years of experience in a commodities trading firm.
Expertise in VaR modelling and risk assessment.
Strong Python programming skills.
Deep understanding of energy markets and pricing structures.
Ability to collaborate with trading and risk teams.

Show more

  • Analyze energy market structures to enhance strategies.
  • Work with trading and risk teams to improve model performance.
  • Implement quantitative models and algorithms in Python.

Key Requirements

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related field. PhD preferred.
  • Several years of experience in a commodities trading firm.
  • Expertise in VaR modelling and risk assessment.
  • Strong Python programming skills.
  • Deep understanding of energy markets and pricing structures.
  • Ability to collaborate with trading and risk teams.

Title: Data Engineer (100-110K CHF)
Description:
Do you want to transform how businesses can leverage real-time data to make smarter decisions?




We are working on behalf of a cutting-edge tech company in Switzerland, specializing in IoT solutions that optimise physical spaces through advanced data analytics and sensor technology and we are currently looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join the team.




What You’ll Do:

Design, implement, and optimise real-time data pipelines for sensor data processing.
Build and deploy production-ready solutions for people counting & tracking (e.g in/out of a shop), air quality monitoring, and energy production analysis.
Develop custom internal tools to enhance data workflows and operational efficiency.
Build, deploy, and maintain scalable data infrastructure, ingesting and standardising data from IoT devices, APIs, and other sources.
Transform complex data into interactive insights that drive business decisions.




Skillset Requirements:

Experience with real-time data processing and IoT data pipelines.
Strong skills in data engineering, ETL processes, and infrastructure deployment.
Proficiency in relevant tools and technologies (e.g., Python, SQL, Apache Kafka, Spark, Airflow).
Ability to work with large-scale sensor data and translate it into actionable insights.
Ideally 6yrs+ experience
Fluent English




Why Join Us?

Work on cutting-edge real-time analytics with a meaningful impact.
Be part of an innovative team pushing the boundaries of IoT and data-driven insights.
Fast-paced, growing startup where you can have an immediate impact
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to transform how businesses can leverage real-time data to make smarter decisions?


We are working on behalf of a cutting-edge tech company in Switzerland, specializing in IoT solutions that optimise physical spaces through advanced data analytics and sensor technology and we are currently looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join the team.


What You’ll Do:

  • Design, implement, and optimise real-time data pipelines for sensor data processing.
  • Build and deploy production-ready solutions for people counting & tracking (e.g in/out of a shop), air quality monitoring, and energy production analysis.
  • Develop custom internal tools to enhance data workflows and operational efficiency.
  • Build, deploy, and maintain scalable data infrastructure, ingesting and standardising data from IoT devices, APIs, and other sources.
  • Transform complex data into interactive insights that drive business decisions.


Skillset Requirements:

  • Experience with real-time data processing and IoT data pipelines.
  • Strong skills in data engineering, ETL processes, and infrastructure deployment.
  • Proficiency in relevant tools and technologies (e.g., Python, SQL, Apache Kafka, Spark, Airflow).
  • Ability to work with large-scale sensor data and translate it into actionable insights.
  • Ideally 6yrs+ experience
  • Fluent English


Why Join Us?

  • Work on cutting-edge real-time analytics with a meaningful impact.
  • Be part of an innovative team pushing the boundaries of IoT and data-driven insights.
  • Fast-paced, growing startup where you can have an immediate impact

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making. 

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

How You Can Make An Impact


Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent



What We Are Looking For:

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently



Consulting and Communication Skills:


Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops



Technical Expertise:


Strong Engineering and/or Mathematics background
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre Future Employeur

Notre client est une prestigieuse institution financière à Genève.

Votre Mission

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez responsable de la collecte, de l’analyse et de l’interprétation de données stratégiques afin de soutenir la prise de décision dans l’entreprise. Vous manipulerez des volumes de données importants, développerez des visualisations et rapports sur mesure, et fournirez des analyses détaillées pour améliorer les performances et les processus internes. Vous participerez également à la mise en œuvre et au suivi des pratiques de gouvernance des données. .

Missions Principales


Gestion des données :
Analyser les données à intégrer dans l’entrepôt de données (DataWareHouse) et définir les règles métier associées.
Effectuer la maintenance analytique du DWH.
Fournir des analyses et rapports à destination des équipes métiers.
Création de rapports et outils décisionnels :
Développer des tableaux de bord, visualisations et rapports interactifs à l’aide de Power BI.
Mettre à disposition des ensembles de données dédiés aux besoins métiers.
Optimisation et gouvernance des données :
Identifier les opportunités d’amélioration dans les processus de collecte et d’exploitation des données.
Contribuer activement à la gouvernance des données et à la gestion du catalogue de données.
Assurer une veille technologique pour intégrer les meilleures pratiques et outils.

Requirements

Profil recherché :


Formation : Diplôme en statistiques, informatique, mathématiques ou domaine associé.
Expérience :
Plus de 4 ans dans un rôle similaire, au sein d’environnements bancaires ou financiers.
Expérience dans l’utilisation d’outils de Business Intelligence et de bases de données complexes.
Connaissance approfondie des problématiques liées à la gestion et à la gouvernance des données.
Expérience dans le secteur bancaire impérative.
Compétences personnelles :
Solides capacités analytiques et rigueur.
Autonomie et capacité à anticiper les besoins.
Esprit novateur et curiosité pour les technologies émergentes.
Compétences techniques requises :
Maîtrise de MS SQL Server et Power BI, bonnes connaissances Dynamics estun plus
Une expérience avec les outils Azure est un plus.

Vous vous épanouirez dans cette organisation si vous possédez:


Un haut niveau de professionnalisme et de sens des responsabilités
Une approche proactive et agile
Un fort esprit d'équipe


Benefits

Ce qui est proposé :


L’opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise établie et prestigieuse
Flexibilité, avantages exceptionnels et un excellent environnement de travail
Show more

  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

Type: Full-Time

Start Date - ASAP

Location – Geneva, Switzerland




JOB DESCRIPTION:




My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).




DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.

The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.




Duties will involve:

Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
Potential to develop core analytics library
Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required




EXPERIENCE:




5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
Good degree in a quantitative discipline




TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Essential

Python
Excel/VBA




Desirable

C++
ML / AI
SQL

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Experience with Pandas or Polars (Dataframes), SQLAlchemy (database toolkit), Streamlit is a plus.
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Good understanding of NoSQL databases: Apache Solr, MongoDB.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organisational skills.
Technical expertise in data mining and modelling techniques.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning models.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub


Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

Title: Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact


Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset



Who We Are Looking For


You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You’re fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines – data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial



Your Team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & Data – empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Requisition ID: 17999

Title: Digital & Sales Analyst
Description:
GENERAL SUMMARY




Seven For All Mankind is looking for a Digital & Sales Analyst to support sales strategies by analysing performance data across all channel but mainly E-Commerce and Wholesale channels. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, data-driven decision-making skills, and a solid understanding of the fashion retail industry.




PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES




Monitor weekly/monthly sales performance for E-Commerce and Wholesale, identifying trends and growth opportunities.
Forecasting - Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop plans, forecasts and projections for e-commerce sales.
Performance Monitoring - Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics related to e-commerce operations, such as conversion rates, average order value, customer acquisition cost, and customer lifetime value. Identifying areas of improvement and opportunities for growth based on performance data.
Web analytics - Sets up tagging in GTM and analyses website traffic and user behavior data using web analytics tools such as Google Analytics. Track metrics such as website visits, page views, bounce rates and conversion rates to assess the effectiveness of the website's design, navigation, and content, and identify opportunities for improvement. Supports a/b test tracking and monitoring.
E-Commerce reporting - Generates regular reports and dashboards to communicate key e-commerce metrics and insights to stakeholders and senior leadership.
Assist the Wholesale team in preparing reports for B2B customers and distributors, analyzing sell-in, sell-out, and stock rotation.
Work closely with the commercial team to track key account performance and suggest strategic actions.
Analyze sell-out data from department stores and multi-brand retailers, identifying risks and opportunities.
Study customer behavior across different markets and channels, identifying purchasing patterns.
Monitor competitors’ pricing, promotions, and digital strategies.
Support demand planning and stock management through data analysis.




QUALIFICATIONS




3-5 years of experience in a Sales Analyst, Business Analyst, and E-Commerce Analyst role within a fashion, retail, or consumer goods company.
Understanding of E-Commerce and/or Wholesale dynamics.
Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (pivot tables, advanced formulas, data analysis).
Experience with BI tools.
In depth knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of ERP and CRM systems for sales and stock analysis.
Strong analytical and data-driven mindset.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).

Show more
HTML:
GENERAL SUMMARY


Seven For All Mankind is looking for a Digital & Sales Analyst to support sales strategies by analysing performance data across all channel but mainly E-Commerce and Wholesale channels. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, data-driven decision-making skills, and a solid understanding of the fashion retail industry.


PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES


  • Monitor weekly/monthly sales performance for E-Commerce and Wholesale, identifying trends and growth opportunities.
  • Forecasting - Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop plans, forecasts and projections for e-commerce sales.
  • Performance Monitoring - Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics related to e-commerce operations, such as conversion rates, average order value, customer acquisition cost, and customer lifetime value. Identifying areas of improvement and opportunities for growth based on performance data.
  • Web analytics - Sets up tagging in GTM and analyses website traffic and user behavior data using web analytics tools such as Google Analytics. Track metrics such as website visits, page views, bounce rates and conversion rates to assess the effectiveness of the website's design, navigation, and content, and identify opportunities for improvement. Supports a/b test tracking and monitoring.
  • E-Commerce reporting - Generates regular reports and dashboards to communicate key e-commerce metrics and insights to stakeholders and senior leadership.
  • Assist the Wholesale team in preparing reports for B2B customers and distributors, analyzing sell-in, sell-out, and stock rotation.
  • Work closely with the commercial team to track key account performance and suggest strategic actions.
  • Analyze sell-out data from department stores and multi-brand retailers, identifying risks and opportunities.
  • Study customer behavior across different markets and channels, identifying purchasing patterns.
  • Monitor competitors’ pricing, promotions, and digital strategies.
  • Support demand planning and stock management through data analysis.


QUALIFICATIONS


  • 3-5 years of experience in a Sales Analyst, Business Analyst, and E-Commerce Analyst role within a fashion, retail, or consumer goods company.
  • Understanding of E-Commerce and/or Wholesale dynamics.
  • Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (pivot tables, advanced formulas, data analysis).
  • Experience with BI tools.
  • In depth knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
  • Knowledge of ERP and CRM systems for sales and stock analysis.
  • Strong analytical and data-driven mindset.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).

Title: Intern Data Science / Management Consulting (m/f/d)
Description:
Be part of our journey

As the digital innovation, design, and transformation brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. With a presence in over 20 countries and more than 60 offices worldwide, it comprises a strong team of over 13,000 strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts, and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences, and business models for sustainable growth.

To strengthen our Intelligent Industry team, we are looking for an Intern in Data Science / Management Consulting (m/f/d) for a period of 6+ months


Be the change: as the innovation and transformation powerhouse of Capgemini, you will support our clients through innovative strategy projects around digital, future-proof topics that challenge and transform the status quo.
Dynamic atmosphere: we offer you entrepreneurial freedom and a collaborative atmosphere within a large company where your opinion is valued and will have a strong impact - on our clients, society, and yourself.
Growth and development: career pathways are transparently communicated, and we offer you the chance to develop personally, such as through our onboarding training program “The Institute” or other tailored training programs within a global network of experts.
Work-life balance: we safeguard work-life balance through a flexible office/home ratio, the possibility of taking a sabbatical, and our Capgemini well-being hub.
Team spirit and community: our regular team and company events allow us to connect in an informal and personal way.
Diversity: we believe that diversity is our greatest strength. Our long-standing corporate culture is open-minded and internationally oriented. We are all role models of empowerment, empathy, and respect.


Bring to life what's next


Support the senior team in developing proof of concept (PoC) products, such as LLM Chatbots for Smart Industrial Application
Assist in organizing design thinking workshops and develop customer journeys
Conduct market research
Help create content on Digital Engineering, Smart Products, Data Strategy, and Digital Transformation and track engagement metrics
Support the senior team in organizing and structuring the deal pipeline and create convincing proposal decks


Your Qualifications


Academic excellence: Outstanding master’s degree in a renowned University in the field of Business or Technology
Industry knowledge: Initial work experience in Innovation, Data Science and/or Digital Marketing through previous internships, with an understanding of Design Thinking and Value Proposition Design
Consulting experience: Initial experiences in consulting and project management are preferred
Conceptual talent: Rational thinking and the ability to combine technological understanding with strategic evaluation and implementation work, i.e., efficient linking of processes between business, strategy, and IT. A structured and hands-on work style, coupled with a fun approach to solving complex tasks. Commitment to self-responsibility regarding deadlines and an entrepreneurial mindset. Eagerness to learn and adapt in uncertain situations while managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Communication and presentation skills: Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is required. Proficiency in German or French (C1 level) is mandatory, along with strong presentation and communication skills.
Digital affinity: Strong affinity and appreciation for Data Science and Digital Transformation, with proficiency in PowerPoint and other marketing software tools.
Cultural fit: High reliability, team spirit, and personal alignment with the values of a leading global management consulting firm (international orientation and openness to travel; integrity).
Duration of employment: Minimum of 6 months
Work permit: Must possess a valid Swiss work permit.


Are you interested in becoming part of our team? We look forward to receiving your complete application exclusively via our application portal, stating your earliest possible start date and salary expectations.
Show more

Title: IT Business Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
Position Overview

For over 150 years, our dedication to being the Global Hausbank for our clients has been driven by our people – in around 60 countries and across more than 150 nationalities.

Their deep understanding, insights, expertise, and passion help our clients navigate an increasingly complex world – be it in our Corporate Bank, our Private Bank, our Investment Bank or our Asset Management division.

Together we can make a great impact for our clients home and abroad, securing their lasting success and financial security.

Analysis and design of technological solutions based on business requirements and processes, as well as on knowledge of existing and future platforms. You will be part of Avaloq Europe Platform Services team and will regularly work with business stakeholders in the elaboration of functional requirements and with development teams for their technical implementation.

You have the drive and the ability to understand the business processes and has in-depth knowledge of Avaloq core banking system (ideally also the respective Deutsche Bank customization and connected satellite systems) and can transform this knowledge into functional solutions and processes that create value and enable our business.

Responsibilities


Defining detailed business requirements with business stakeholders
Reviewing solution proposals and specifications from Avaloq as a vendor
Supporting the implementation teams in design phase to ensure that the implementation fulfils business requirements and solutions are consistent with potential evolution
Cooperation with Business Architecture and Solution Architecture teams to ensure that solutions are in line with target architecture and technical roadmap
Hands-on test execution and test support for expert users
Close interaction and alignment with various business areas to ensure that all the requirements are fulfilled in all the solutions implemented
Strive for simplicity in designs and solutions
Act as a go-to person which business stakeholders can reach out for receiving subject matter expert advice, guidance and training
Close cooperation with the Center of Competence for driving test automation forward and engage the respective SMEs for reviewing effort estimations and detailed solution designs
You will be responsible for the adequacy of the proposed solutions (from its definition to its implementation) in collaboration with business and technical teams.
You will be integrated into Avaloq Europe Platform Services team where it will be necessary to coordinate multidisciplinary teams and manage collaboration with Avaloq as a vendor and other 3rd parties.



Skills


Strongly familiar with Avaloq Core Platform; Avaloq certification is a plus
Experience in JIRA, Confluence and HP ALM will be a plus
Experience in project management and knowledge about the entire application development life cycle (planning, budget, approval, sourcing, monitoring and implementation) including Agile methodology
Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Computing or similar. Master recommended.
5+ years of experience in functional analysis in area of Private Banking, Wealth Management.
Ability to identify risks, resolve conflicts and plan tasks
Self-motivated and flexibility to work autonomously coupled with ability to work in virtual teams and matrix/global organizations including appreciation of different cultures during collaborating and sharing.
Organized self-starter able to manage in a complex environment
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
English proficiency required



Well-being & Benefits


Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health.
Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive.
Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self confidence and well being.
Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future.



Our cultural aspiration is to be ‘empowered to excel together every day’. This means we strive for the highest standards of integrity, are accountable while learning from mistakes, promote speaking up and constructively challenge each other to further innovation. Seeking out conversations, proactively embracing change, new facts and different perspectives helps our talented and diverse teams to work in partnership across the globe and drive business results.

We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a positive and fair working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.
Show more

Title: Analyst IP Intelligence
Description:
Work Location: Satigny, Geneva, Switzerland

Hybrid

As an Analyst in IP Intelligence, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding dsm-firmenich’s intellectual property by providing strategic patent research in chemistry and related fields. You will be responsible for conducting comprehensive patent searches and providing competitive IP intelligence and benchmarking as well as other IP due diligence and strategic insights to support innovation, business and intellectual property strategies.

At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work to not only benefit our People, Customers & Communities but also drive business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct comprehensive patent searches using patent databases and tools known in the field.
Analyze patent landscapes to identify trends, opportunities, and potential risks.
Prepare detailed reports and summaries of search results.
Collaborate with IP Attorneys and R&D stakeholders to support patent filing and prosecution, as well as with IP Attorneys and business stakeholders to support strategic IP initiatives.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments and tools related to patent searching.
Utilize AI-related tools to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of patent searches and analysis.


You Bring


At least a Bachelor's (BSc) degree in Chemistry, or equivalent Swiss qualifications (e.g., ETH Zurich, EPFL). A Master's (MSc) degree or PhD is preferred.
Basic understanding of IUPAC nomenclature, with a desire to deepen that understanding.
3-5 years of experience as a Patent Searcher/Analyst in the field of Chemistry, with specific experience in patent landscaping and competitive analysis.
Proficiency in essential patent searching tools (e.g., PatBase, STN, Derwent, etc.).
Experience with AI-related tools in the patent search/analysis field is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills.


We Bring


A highly skilled team of intellectual property professionals with specialized knowledge in the complex and dynamic field of nutrition, health and beauty.
A diverse range of exciting technologies to explore and protect.
Opportunities to collaborate with top scientists and business leaders in the industry.
Extensive career development prospects, with ample opportunities for learning and growth.
A company dedicated to building a strong legacy through groundbreaking innovation and technology.
The opportunity to work for a highly socially responsible company where sustainability is much more than a claim and is core to our strategy and purpose.


dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: (here,) there’s a place for everyone with us.

dsm-firmenich is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Our people are as diverse as our customers. For us that includes a commitment to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.  

We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world’s growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than €12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life™ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.

www.dsm-firmenich.com
Show more
